story:
My story

Since 1990 I have been travelling to Mozambique and visiting the Island of Inhaca, 45 km from Maputo City.  Development on the island has been minimal over the years, but sadly the problems of poaching and deforestation have had an adverse effect on island species. My love for nature, the mangroves and the colourful turtles and fiddler crabs have always had my attention.

Five species of marine turtles occur and nest in the coastal and marine zone of Ilha De Inhaca (Inhaca Island), as well as the 'one clawed' fiddler crab. In Mozambique, marine turtles and the fiddler crab receive limited attention in regards to research and conservation. The Island community is doing well, but being a poor country, more resources are a great help.

The existing turtle and fiddler crab populations are growing.  To help sustain this, I have set up this campaign to enable more resources for appropriate management, awareness, education and implementation.

Many threats exist, from global warming sea change, to habitat and coastal erosion. The island is near pristine and this campaign intends to help keep it that way. 




Ecological value

Briefly marine turtles and fiddler crabs play a fundamental ecological role. As consumers (algae, seagrass, sponges etc) and as prey (eggs, juveniles and adults), they are important in the food chain of coastal and marine ecosystems. Currently there is no tourist operations focusing on turtle  and fiddler crab watching. The growth of coastal tourism on the island will stimulate the development of this activity, which will be undertaken by both tourism operators as well as the  local community. Local community involvement is already in existence, and with your funding, you will give the community more resources.


The Inhaca turle and fiddler crab sanctuaries

More resources allow for ;

  • Wider awareness education campaign through printed materials.
  • Equipment for the local marine rangers to combat poaching.
  • Communication equipment for the conservation authorities.
  • Equipment to help identification, nest monitoring, protection, tagging, threat management  and conservation measures.
  • Cleanup and rehabilitation of effected beach and mangrove zones.

      

   

                                                  

Over the many years of interacting with the island community, I and my associates have developed a personal and meaningful relationship with the rangers and educators on the island. I have informed them of the 'Indiegogo' crowd funding platform available. Now I want to show them that there are communities and people worldwide who care.  Your donations show this.

                                                             


Your Impact and our first goal

Your donation will impact directly in providing more and better means to protect existing and future turtle and fiddler crab colonies. 

Donators to this campaign get mention in our 'Visitors Book'.  This book is to be presented to the Biology Museum on the Island. The museum on the island has attached to it a Research Station. The museum is run  by the University of Eduardo Mondale in Maputo.   Future visitors will see, read and comment in our 'Visitors Book" when visiting the museum , and  as this book grows, so do you.


             


Literature is also be printed and distributed as an educational tool to tourists and locals.


Our future goal

The goal would be to fund local sculptors ands artists to create tourism artworks that will promote this initiative.  The artwork of the locals is both unique, detailed, colourful and sought after. The proceeds of the artwork sold will refund and help sustain this initiative.

         

      

     



Your perks

Ever cent donated is not to be wasted. 

A future website dedicated to this initiative is being designed and once our goal is reached, everybody gets listed on a dedicated donators page.  This website is to be run by local community members. The site will grow and with the resources of our foundation, it will develop and have a life of its own. The possibilities are endless.

 You will receive updates of what is taking place on the island with pictures and more.   Local artists products will be for sale through the site and in time new products will grow.  Should you wish to visit this amazing island, we will arrange everything for you.

A special 'handing over'  will take place at the Biology Museum. A song of thanks will be recorded and placed on the website.  

Donators of $100 or more will have their names recorded in the hand-made commemorative signage that is to be erected, recording the occasion and your generosity, for all to see.

Your $200 donation is dedicated to many  turtle and many fiddler crabs, and their future broods. You get a personal framed thank you certificate from the Turtle and Fiddler Crab Sanctuary.  The website will run updates on the initiative's achievements.

Donations of $3000  get our special 'donator camping package' for food and camping accommodation with our affiliated eco-tourist camping resort.  On the Santa Maria snorkelling beach.  Eating the freshest fish directly from the sea, snorkelling in the crystal clear water of 'Santa Maria', the Inhaca Island  world famous eco-marine reserve.  Or just swimming at 'Portuguese Island' and walking on un-populated safe, mile long beaches. 

Donations of $4800 get our special 'donator luxury accommodation package' for food and accommodation and so much more at our affiliated eco-tourist luxury hotel, right on the beach, with separate cottage accommodation in the magnificent palm garden.

 

            

                                                                                 

                             Camping site                                                     Hotel resort   

                                         

       

                                           INHACA ISLAND, MOZAMBIQUE


                          A special thank you  

                           

Please tell your friends about this campaign and help us reach our goals.


From those that you will be helping, we from the SPINMOTOR FOUNDATION        say on their behalf,        'Thank you'     'Thank you'    'Thank you'




                                                           

                                            World Changing Motor Technology

story:
The Farm at The Estate Greenhouse Project


How You Can Help:

The Farm is seeking contributors to help us raise a greenhouse before the growing season starts. We are looking forward to growing as many heirloom and organic plants as possible. As always, all surplus will be made available to local food pantries and to anyone with a need. Please feel free to keep us up to date on anyone that could use a basket of food as the year rolls on. 

My hope is to use this greenhouse to aid in the establishment of a permaculture food forest and farm that will yield perennial foods, (greens,nuts, fruits, chickens, pigs, and others) as well as annual foods.

The additional funds raised will help us continue to build our farm with the goal of providing others with the tools and techniques to be autonomous and to create autonomous communities by freeing up money for other aspects of the project. 

The Impact:

Our long term goals for the greenhouse are the following:

  1. Provide local food pantries with fruits, vegetables, meat and eggs. 
  2. Save organic heirloom seed for local farmers, back yard farmers, and the urban landscape as a means to maintain seed genetic diversity.
  3. Make those seeds available to others. 
  4. Provide locally grown food to those that choose to support our mission. 
  5. Build model sites (in cities, towns, and country) of permaculture farming techniques that lead to food security, communities, and autonomy. 
  6. And do so while caring for the earth and people by conducting responsible farming without the use of fertilizers, pesticides, or any other nasties. 

Additionally this is the first of a few steps in creating a Permaculture Research Institute for New Hampshire which will provide plant stock and seed diversity to people working towards autonomy and stability in our communities. We seek to provide the tools and demonstration sites that will be a model for individuals, municipalities, and our cities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial contribution is unrealistic for you and you would like to help in another way, we can always use hands in the dirt. Please feel free to contact me at jason.a.vivier@gmail.com. We do need all the help we can get.

story:
Hello! My name is Kathe Hashimoto. 

I have always enjoyed the great outdoors, and I am passionate about preserving undeveloped space for wildlife habitat and the mental health of humans. I have always fantasized about exploring other parts of the world and have always thought that the best way to get to know a place is to go there with a purpose!

Over the past few months, I've learned about Lake Hovsgol from the Mongolia Ecology Center. They have one goal...to establish a National Park infrastructure for the amazing, unpolluted and pristine wilderness areas of Mongolia to preserve them for future generations. I have been moved by the beauty of Mongolia and one of the last, ancient largest freshwater lakes in the world, Lake Hovsgol. The Mongolians call this body of water "The Mother Sea".  But this place is on the verge of being destroyed if we don't act now.  Until recently, this area had been left in tact because getting here is extremely difficult. However, a paved road to Lake Hovsgol is nearing completion from the capital of Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar, and soon the amount of visitors to the lake will skyrocket.  In addition, the lake is threatened from illegal poaching of endangered wildlife, illegal mining and logging.  MEC is working tirelessly with the help of the US National Park Service and the European Union to insure the infrastructure is in place to handle the increase in visitation to the park.  But Mongolia is a developing country and the funding just isn't available to cover everything...mainly the equipment the rangers need to enforce the rules. The Lake and the wildlife park around it are unique on this planet, and under threat from poachers and illegal developers driving wherever they choose in jeeps and 4x4's.  

The park is patrolled by rangers, mostly on horseback or on dilapidated motorcycles. The rangers need better transportation to effectively do their job of catching poachers and illegal developers. The motorcycles they have are falling apart. and their horses are even less effective.


What am I doing to help? 

I am raising funds that will go toward buying an off-road motorcycle and gear.  On my own dime, I am going to Mongolia to deliver them to the rangers in person. I will pay for my airfare, and I am volunteering my time here in SF with fundraising events and coordination. My role there will be as a documentary photographer and videographer. I will travel via van with other members of the support crew. My teammates will train them in off-road riding techniques and motorcycle maintenance. It'll be a long, bumpy ride of 1200 miles in 9 days, but worth it to help preserve such a beautiful place. 

The Rally is also being documented by a Mongolian film company. The footage will be made into a documentary to be released this November. The Rally will also be covered by Asian media.


Lake Hovsgol is one of the last best places!

The Lake and surrounding wildlife area is bigger than Yellowstone and strictly protected as a transition zone between Central Asian Steppe and the Siberian Taiga.  It's one of 17 ancient lakes that are more than 2 million years old, and the water is so clean you can drink it without any treatment.  There are a number of indigenous people that live around it and depend on it for their water supply.  In fact, it contains 70% of all the surface freshwater supply for the whole country of Mongolia.  There is no body of water this clean and this large in the United States.


So what's threatening it?

Illegal poaching, including illegal drift net fishing, illegal logging: The lake has fish, including two endemic species, and since it's a lake, those fish can easily become overfished as every other fish population in the world has become.  The surrounding parklands are home to a number of rare animals, including ibex, argali, elk, wolf, wolverine, musk deer, brown bear, Siberian moose, and sable.

Mongolia has done a good job designating this area as a wildlife preserve to protect the survival of these animals, but enforcement is challenging.  Rangers have been stabbed and injured trying to enforce the law against poachers, who stand to make a great deal of money in the short term.

Illegal development and tourism: It isn't surprising that developers, Mongolian and foreign alike, are interested in developing around the lake.  Rangers have caught individuals simply building around it without permits. Run off and pollution from illegal development and road building is certain to pollute the lake, as well as negatively impact wildlife habitat.  Additionally outsiders have come in and started developing environmental tourism projects without obtaining permission or taking the necessary precautions to protect the ecosystem.


But they have rangers to enforce the laws, right?

Yes, the whole park is about 4,600 square miles (1.2mm hectares) and there are 15 permanent rangers and a few seasonal ones.  Each ranger patrols over 300 square miles of park, which is about the same size as all the boroughs in New York City, and they do it mostly on horseback.  

Imagine if there was only one policeman in a space as big as the five boroughs of New York City, and he was on horseback chasing bad guys in jeeps.

The poachers and illegal users in the park tool around in jeeps, 4x4's, and other vehicles.  Did I also mention the poachers are armed?

The rangers have asked for help by in the form of off-road motorcycles, gear, and training.  With modern off-road motorcycles, they could patrol more effectively.


So why do I care, and how can YOU help?

It's true, Mongolia is halfway around the world, but I care, and here's why:

  • We don't have that many wild places left in the world.  
  • We don't have that much wildlife left in the world, 10 animal species went extinct in 2013!
  • I love nature, I spend a lot of time in nature, and it's not often that I get to actually do hands-on volunteering to not only help protect one of the last pristine natural places in the world, but at the same time help improve the work life of an individual who is protecting this area. That's something I can feel good about!

Even if you aren't moved by this situation, I ask that you support me in my effort to keep this wild area as pristine as possible. You can help by donating to help cover the cost of a motorcycle and equipment.

Where does the money go?

100% of the money you donate is tax-deductible, and goes to buy and ship the motorcycle and equipment. I am paying my own ticket over, and the Mongol Ecology Center is not taking any of it for administration, it all goes directly to equipment for the rangers! 

I am trying to fund one motorcycle and equipment.  Each motorcycle and equipment, along with shipping, costs $7,550.   I am trying to raise enough to outfit one ranger.  Any additional money goes to buying a second motorcycle if I exceed my fundraising goal.  

If I raise additional funds, but not enough for an entire motorcycle and gear, the Mongol Ecology Center has agreed to pool it with the funds raised by other volunteers to fund another complete motorcycle.

How you can help

Donate, and donate BIG and soon!!! My fundraising campaign only lasts one month.

I will pay for my airfare, and I am volunteering my time here in SF with fundraising events and coordination. My role there will be as a documentary photographer and videographer. I will travel via van with other members of the support crew. My teammates will train them in off-road riding techniques and motorcycle maintenance. It'll be a long, bumpy ride of 1200 miles in 9 days, but worth it to help preserve such a beautiful place. The Rally is also being documented by a Mongolian film company. The footage will be made into a documentary to be released this November. The Rally will also be covered by Asian media.Lake Hovsgol is one of the last best places!The Lake and surrounding wildlife area is bigger than Yellowstone and strictly protected as a transition zone between Central Asian Steppe and the Siberian Taiga.  It's one of 17 ancient lakes that are more than 2 million years old, and the water is so clean you can drink it without any treatment.  There are a number of indigenous people that live around it and depend on it for their water supply.  In fact, it contains 70% of all the surface freshwater supply for the whole country of Mongolia.  There is no body of water this clean and this large in the United States.So what's threatening it?Illegal poaching, including illegal drift net fishing, illegal logging: The lake has fish, including two endemic species, and since it's a lake, those fish can easily become overfished as every other fish population in the world has become.  The surrounding parklands are home to a number of rare animals, including ibex, argali, elk, wolf, wolverine, musk deer, brown bear, Siberian moose, and sable.Mongolia has done a good job designating this area as a wildlife preserve to protect the survival of these animals, but enforcement is challenging.  Rangers have been stabbed and injured trying to enforce the law against poachers, who stand to make a great deal of money in the short term.Illegal development and tourism: It isn't surprising that developers, Mongolian and foreign alike, are interested in developing around the lake.  Rangers have caught individuals simply building around it without permits. Run off and pollution from illegal development and road building is certain to pollute the lake, as well as negatively impact wildlife habitat.  Additionally outsiders have come in and started developing environmental tourism projects without obtaining permission or taking the necessary precautions to protect the ecosystem.But they have rangers to enforce the laws, right?Yes, the whole park is about 4,600 square miles (1.2mm hectares) and there are 15 permanent rangers and a few seasonal ones.  Each ranger patrols over 300 square miles of park, which is about the same size as all the boroughs in New York City, and they do it mostly on horseback.  Imagine if there was only one policeman in a space as big as the five boroughs of New York City, and he was on horseback chasing bad guys in jeeps.The poachers and illegal users in the park tool around in jeeps, 4x4's, and other vehicles.  Did I also mention the poachers are armed?The rangers have asked for help by in the form of off-road motorcycles, gear, and training.  With modern off-road motorcycles, they could patrol more effectively.So why do I care, and how can YOU help?It's true, Mongolia is halfway around the world, but I care, and here's why:
We don't have that many wild places left in the world.  
We don't have that much wildlife left in the world, 10 animal species went extinct in 2013!
I love nature, I spend a lot of time in nature, and it's not often that I get to actually do hands-on volunteering to not only help protect one of the last pristine natural places in the world, but at the same time help improve the work life of an individual who is protecting this area. That's something I can feel good about!
Even if you aren't moved by this situation, I ask that you support me in my effort to keep this wild area as pristine as possible. You can help by donating to help cover the cost of a motorcycle and equipment.Where does the money go?100% of the money you donate is tax-deductible, and goes to buy and ship the motorcycle and equipment. I am paying my own ticket over, and the Mongol Ecology Center is not taking any of it for administration, it all goes directly to equipment for the rangers! I am trying to fund one motorcycle and equipment.  Each motorcycle and equipment, along with shipping, costs $7,550.   I am trying to raise enough to outfit one ranger.  Any additional money goes to buying a second motorcycle if I exceed my fundraising goal.  If I raise additional funds, but not enough for an entire motorcycle and gear, the Mongol Ecology Center has agreed to pool it with the funds raised by other volunteers to fund another complete motorcycle.How you can helpDonate, and donate BIG and soon!!! My fundraising campaign only lasts one month.

story:
Green is Good. Green is Vital. Green is Now.

Gasoline is already the fuel of the past. The search is on, but what will the fuel of the future be?  Zero Pollution Motors, LLC predicts compressed air

That's right! Air. Zero Pollution Motors (ZPM) is poised to produce cars powered by compressed air by the second half of 2015.  As the first U.S. licensee for Luxembourg-based MDI (www.mdi.lu), developer of the AIRPod, ZPM has attained the rights to build a production plant in the United States.

The AIRPod is the solution to urban pollution and urban mobility. With its small size, a tiny price, zero pollution, and a fun and futuristic design, AIRPod marks a turning point in the landscape of urban transportation. It is a real breath of fresh air in cities and the prelude to travel without pollution. A car that runs on air eliminates the air pollution of internal combustion engines. Air is a more sustainable option than electric because of the absence of large toxic batteries, which are expensive to produce and end up in landfills. A compressed air tank can be refilled in the same amount of time as a gas tank, as opposed to 8-10 hours of charging required for electric cars. Air can be compressed by solar, wind or hydroelectric power, virtually eliminating any carbon footprint in the operation of the AIRPod.

Zero Pollution Motors, LLC is launching in the United States the urban car of the future, now.  



Technology

How can compressed air fuel a car?  The laws of physics dictate that uncontained gases will fill any given space. The easiest way to see this in action is to inflate a balloon. The elastic skin of the balloon holds the air tightly inside, but the moment you use a pin to create a hole in the balloon's surface, the air expands outward turning the potential energy of the compressed air inside the balloon into a burst of useable kinetic energy. This may sound dangerous, but the AIRPod is entirely safe.  The tanks are made of carbon fibre.  In the event of a crash the tanks will split, releasing the air in a controlled and safe manner, with zero chance of an explosion of any kind. Compressing a gas into a small space is a way to store energy. When the gas expands again, that energy is released to do work. This principle is the basis behind what makes an air car run. 


Business Strategy

Zero Pollution Motors, LLC will be following the MDI “Dealer – Manufacturer – Partner” concept by creating turnkey micro production factories to manufacture their vehicles locally in regions throughout the United States. Unlike the huge classic assembly factories, these plants will sell 80% of the vehicles in the same geographic location they are produced. In the MDI production concept, the suppliers are chosen in a way to reduce costs, logistics and freight.  All the purchases are managed at the MDI central purchasing unit, to benefit from the advantages of bulk buying.

Hawaii is the anticipated location for the initial production plant. Hawaii is the most fossil fuel dependent state in the nation and importing oil to meet the demand is not sustainable. The Hawaii Clean Energy Initiative (HCEI), a federal-state-private partnership, is charting a new course toward energy independence. This environment is perfect for introducing compressed air technology to the US. 

Following are the benefits derived from using micro production factories and the "Dealer - Manufacturer - Partner" concept compared to conventional production system: 

Ecological Benefits

  • Only one third of the ground surface is necessary
  • Better distribution of the energy used for production
  • No pollution due to the transport of the finished products

Economic Benefits

  • The currency remains in the country
  • Creation of local employment
  • Customers buy cars that are produced locally (especially public services)
  • Reduction of import duties/taxes (very high in some countries)
  • Logistics expenses are drastically reduced
  • No cost associated with storage of spare parts


Traction

  • Successful prototypes have been developed.
  • Tata Motors Limited, the india based multinational automotive manufacturing company has completed proof of the technical concept in their compressed air vehicles in May, 2012.
  • The AIRPod was well received when tested at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport
  • Our website has had tens of thousands of visitors. We even registered more than 3,400 interested parties in one day during a special event!
  • The AIRPod has received formal interest from the NY Taxi and limousine commission, USPS, Club Car and various other delivery operators.
  • Actor Rocky Carroll (NCIS, Chicago Hope, Roc) is our official sponsors.

Management

Actor Rocky Carroll (NCIS, Chicago Hope, Roc) is our official sponsors.

story:
You Can Help Make A Difference

Wildlife in Africa is under severe threat. Many animals are on the verge of extinction while others enjoy little attention or protection.   In South Africa, hundreds  of thousands of small and large wild animals die every year as a result of lethal methods used to keep predators off farming lands.    

Few alternatives  are available to farmers who strive to secure their livelihoods amidst a widespread conflict affecting the business of meat production.  It is estimated that predators attacking livestock  costs farmers $125 million every year and farmers are desperate to find a win-win solution in addressing this human- wildlife conflict .  Our farmers are as eager as we are to find a way to protect livestock from predators.   With your support we can make a difference.


Who We Are

Conservation South Africa is a non-profit organization based in the Northern, Eastern and Western Cape Provinces of South Africa.  For over 20 years our team of dedicated staff have worked with local people, scientists and decision makers to find creative solutions to environmental challenges.

        www.southafrica.conservation.org


What We Are Doing

We are working with scientists, veterinarians, farmers and our partner, the Cape Leopard Trust to find a scientifically tested solution for farmers to live in harmony with predators and produce red meat in a truly WILDLIFE FRIENDLY manner.  To do this we are gathering scientific data and testing the effectiveness of Anatolian guard dogs and a combination of dogs and shephards to protect livestock from danger.  

Our Anatolian guard dogs are bred on the grounds of Namaqua National Park  in South Africa’s Northern Cape.  When they are old enough to be separated from their mothers we place the puppies on farms. They have strong protective instincts and they quickly bond with the livestock they grow up with.


This bond never dwindles but gets stronger and stronger as they mature. Anatolian guard dogs never tire of their duties, checking up on their flocks throughout the night and walking amidst their flock to safeguard them from predators. The dogs patrol where their flock graze and mark the area with scat and urine to deter predators.  If a dog detects danger it gives off a deep warning bark that scares away any looming threats -  and if pushed will take action to get it's livestock to safety.    Farmers  have put their trust in our team and have taken bold steps to try new ways of farming in an environmentally friendly manner. 


A full grown Anatolian dog and his "family" - Many farmers  have already experienced a significant decrease in stock losses since the project started. 

While we are learning and monitoring how effective Anatolian dog guarding is - so too are we researching the behavior of predators in an effort to understand and plan for their reactions.  

To do this, a team of scientists that includes staff, partners and volunteers, monitor carefully placed camera’s that take photos triggered by movement.  This has allowed us to estimate predator and prey abundance and diversity. We also capture, GPS collar and track healthy specimens of black-backed jackal and big cats like leopards and caracal. 

This technology is an essential tool that helps us understand what they hunt and eat, where and how far they prefer to roam and what actions they choose to take when faced with obstacles that prevent them from making a kill on farms.



This large 60kg male leopard  was collared on Valentine's day 2014.  In honor of the special day he was named Valentine.  In the last three months he has fed on large animals like oryx and red hartebeest and a few livestock.  Valentine was captured before we placed Anatolian guard dogs on farms  and we are looking forward to seeing how he adjusts to the presence of  the guard dogs.

Pieter Pan, an adult male caracal, was captured and collared when he was attracted to a pie pan which was nailed to a post  and scented with urine for good measure.   Researchers were able to track and monitor Pieter Pan’s movement and diet  for quite some time but sadly,Pieter Pan died after being caught in a  gin trap while roaming between farms. 

We Need Your Support

Your support will help us find solutions to provide a shared landscape between farmers and predators like Valentine, the leopard and Pieter, the caracal.  Without the science to rigorously test methods, predator-farmer conflict will persist.  

With your support we can continue to work towards mitigating conflict and maintaining a biologically diverse landscape.  We will arm farmers with farm management methods to protect their livestock while conserving biodiversity and simultaneously providing wildlife-friendly meat to South African consumers.


What We Need & What You Get

With your support we can cover some of the ongoing monitoring and support costs to continue to make this project a success.  

  • GPS collars 
  • Cameras &  equipment maintenance
  • Veterinarian services
  • Vehicle maintenance and fuel for extension staff, to visit farmers, train farm staff, transport, dogs , deliver supplies to farms, help trapped animals and the tracking and collaring of predators.
  • Dog food
In addition to knowing your gift has the potential to help save our wildlife, we have listed some perks on the right hand side of this page to show you how much we appreciate your support.

The Impact

Your support will help secure the safety and future of wildlife in South Africa.  Your support of this program will allow us to promote scientifically proven wildlife friendly predator management guidelines that can be adopted by livestock farmers and retailers in South Africa and globally.

Through this project we will halt the use of lethal predator control methods in the production of all red meat in South Africa.

Additionally, through this research we are testing a combination of dogs and rangers on several farms.  This has created employment for 6 local people as ecological monitors who now carry out restoration activities and  monthly field condition assessments as they walk in the field with the livestock and dogs .  

This is helping us monitor the ecosystem health and provide guidance to farmers on better ways to manage and restore badly degraded lands.


Risks & Challenges

There are always risks associated with work involving unpredictable animal behavior.  However we have taken many steps to mitigate what we think may cause problems for us along the way.

  • Health - Veterinarians are constantly on call should any animals need medical attention for any reason.  They assist us when we place trackers on animals and ensure that they are carefully handled and set loose as quickly as possible.
  • Basic Conditions - Our extension staff visit our farmers every week and help keep the lines of communication open .  They check in on the dogs and ensure they are healthy and happy and provide ongoing ecological training to staff on farms.  
  • Mitigating for loss during testing -   A local insurance company has partnered with us to help with insurance should any farmer experience any stock losses during the course of these trials. This way the risks are reduced and farmers are more willing to be a part of this project.
  • Sustainability - The cost of keeping a dog only or even a human and dog combination with livestock is significantly cheaper for farmers than the cost these losses currently incur.   If farmers have scientific evidence that this method works they have indicated they would be happy to take on these costs themselves.
  •  Wider Uptake  - A large, leading retailer is ready and willing to implement best practice guidelines in their supply chains should our research prove to be successful.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Every time you share our campaign through your social media networks or by using the Indiegogo tools you are helping us protect another wild animal.  Promoting our campaign shows the world that the survival of Africa's wildlife is important to YOU TOO.   Helping the cause of wild animals at risk makes you a wildlife warrior in our book!
  • Ask more questions about how your food is produced and what impacts its production has had on nature.
  • Your choices as a consumer dictates demand - demand ethically produced products.
  • Read more about our work at Conservation South Africa

Read more about our work at Conservation South Africa

story:
Become a Supporter of the Journey

Exciting news from the Heart of the World - La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta in Colombia:

 What started two years ago as a simple project to research and write a book with the indigenous Elders of Colombia's Sierra Nevada has, not surprisingly, taken many turns. It has now evolved into a multi-faceted project that includes the writing of a novel that will share the environmental and spiritual message of the Elders, plus a feature-length motion picture adaptation of the book, and now a significant opportunity to help return sacred lands to the indigenous peoples of the mountain.

 The writing of the book continues and now includes adapting it to form the basis of a major motion picture that will greatly expand the audience for the spiritual and environmental message of the Elders.

 I originally intended to live with the indigenous peoples and learn from them in their villages. That has happened, but now I actually have a group of indigenous boys - designated future Elders - living with me in my village! They are attending the local public school to learn more of the world beyond their world and to learn English so that they can participate in spreading their spiritual and environmental message.

It Takes a Village

 Recently I had the opportunity of spending some time living with them in their village - a 'new' village, built in the traditional manner in just the past few years. The Kogi, Arhuaco and Wiwa peoples are thriving, in spite of all the pressure to encroach upon their sacred lands and damage our Earth Mother - la madre tierra.

 Much of their sacred land has been occupied over the years by squatters - campesinos - farmers who simply moved in and fenced off a part of the sacred lands and began slash-and-burn deforestation and the planting of commercial crops.

 While the new tenants have no legal right to the indigenous land they now occupy, removing them and restoring the land to the indigenous peoples is not easy.

 I have recently been offered an exceptional opportunity to just that. A compaseno couple who the indigenous people of the area respect has offered to turn his land over to the Arhuaco and depart, providing the indigenous with an opportunity to expand their village and farm the very fertile valley.

 For only the equivalent of four thousand US dollars I can, in effect, 'buy' this entire valley back and return it to its rightful owners, the indigenous peoples of la Sierra. The purchase price is a small payment for the extensive improvements that have been made to the property and will ensure that the property is vacated and returned to the indigenous peoples as a home for their growing traditional community.

 I am inviting you to participate in this exciting opportunity to right at least a few of the wrongs that have been vested on the indigenous community over the past five hundred years. And I promise that I will keep you informed on all the progress as a new village takes form. In fact, I invite you to come to Colombia one day and be welcomed into the village yourself, to spend a few days experiencing the community you have helped create.

 Your small contribution will be used to buy back the land and improvements and to begin replacing the buildings with new traditional huts and establishing new traditional farms and gardens.

 Below is an updated version of the original IndieGoGo.com funding campaign and description. The project has grown significantly since this was first launched two years ago, but it still gives you an idea of what the indigenous community and I are hoping to accomplish together.

Do You Believe a Book - and a Movie - Can Change the World?

 I do.

Do you remember reading a special book when you were younger - one that changed your life.

 I do.

 If you believe in the power of a book, as I do, I invite you to participate in changing the life of a young reader, maybe thousands of young readers - and in saving the planet - by supporting this very special book - and movie - project.


JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD will be an engaging young adult fantasy novel based on a true story. And now it will also be a major motion picture! Christian Castagno is a teenager living in New York when his mother dies of cancer. She leaves behind an illustrated handwritten letter, written when he was conceived, describing the life adventures that await him. Chris tells the story of being led by a talking butterfly, in a series of what may or may not have been dreams, to a mystical mountain in South America where he meets a wise teacher, the elder of a lost tribe of indigenous peoples who fled the coast at the time of Columbus - a people who believe themselves to be the Heart of the World. The spiritual and environmental teachings of the shamanic elder trigger several dream-like heroic adventures through Chris’s past and future lives, including being present as the Spanish conquistadors land on the Colombian coast and participating in conversations between Thomas Edison  and Henry Ford. In the end, the hero comes to understand the true purpose of life and the prescription for saving the life of his endangered Earth Mother.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR – JOHN LUNDIN - AND AN UPDATE FROM THE FIELD

John Lundin with the Mamos of La Sierra Nevada

 I am the author of THE NEW MANDALA - Eastern Wisdom for Western Living, written in collaboration with His Holiness the Dalai Lama, a book that presented the message of the Buddha to western readers. I have recently been invited by the elders - the Mamos - of the indigenous descendants of the Tairona of the Sierra Nevada in Colombia - people who fled the Spanish invasion in the 1500s and whose culture has remain largely unchanged for five hundred years - to live with them and to learn from them and to write a book that will share their urgent message, the message that our Earth Mother is in trouble and that we are the only ones who can save her.

 I have chosen to write a young adult fantasy novel, not unlike Harry Potter or Lord of the Rings or The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, one that will appeal to young adult readers since they are the planet's only hope for the future. It will not be a "preachy" book, but it will be an engaging fantasy adventure story with a serious message, one that young people will want to read and one that parents and teachers will encourage them to read.

Update from the field, March 2014: A production company has been formed and is already working on assembling a team to bring the book to the wide screen. The research continues, the teachings from the elders are more intense, and the actual writing of the book is well underway. Several chapters have already been written, and Chapter One of JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD can now be previewed in its entirety at my website, www.JohnLundin.com


JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD - When a teenager from the Catskills is led by a talking butterfly to the mountain home of a lost tribe in the jungles of South America, the elders’ sacred teachings initiate dream-like adventures through his past and future lives, revealing the secrets of their spiritual and environmental message – and the purpose of life.


SCOPE OF THE PROJECT

 I am currently living in Colombia, in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, receiving sacred teachings from the shamanic elders, the Mamos, of the Kogi, the Arhuaco, the Wiwa and the Cankuamo, ancient peoples who have not changed their ways since fleeing the Spanish invasion five hundred years ago. I have been invited to live among them, to experience their culture and to learn from them. They are very suspicious of outsiders, but they know their Earth Mother is in danger of dying unless we, whom they refer to as their Young Brother, change our ways. They have asked me to listen to their plea and to write a book that will convey their urgent spiritual and environmental message to the world. This will not be a book about these profoundly spiritual people, but instead it will be a book that allows the reader to experience their message – a book and movie that will engage the reader’s imagination in a manner that touches the heart.  It will be a book that can change young lives, and ultimately change the world.

 WHAT WILL YOUR PLEDGE BE USED FOR?

 Your contribution to this new campaign will be used to buy back a beautiful parcel of sacred land - an entire valley in la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta - so that it may be returned to its rightful owners, the indigenous Arhuaco, and can become a new traditional village. This multi-faceted project also requires a great deal of travel, for visits with the indigenous elders in their secluded villages and for research in general. I am currently living in Minca, an eco-village in the foothills of La Sierra Nevada, just above the coastal city of Santa Marta.  The Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta is a unique pyramid-shaped mountain range adjacent to, but not geologically related to, the Andes. From its base at sea level the mountains rise to an altitude of 18,000 feet in just 24 miles. La Sierra contains areas of most every micro-climate on the planet, from beaches and deserts to tropical rain forest and coastal jungle to snow-capped glacial peaks. It is also one of the most bio-diverse regions in the world. The indigenous peoples have villages scattered throughout the Sierra, and move from village to village to cultivate their crops according to the altitude and changes of seasons, and to perform their Earth-saving spiritual and environmental rituals.

 Travel to these secluded villages requires lengthy and arduous trips that include the hiring of off-road vehicles and drivers, and even mules and pack animals. On each of these trips I also bring food and supplies to the villagers. In addition to learning from the indigenous elders in their villages, my research for the book includes visits with local environmentalists, anthropologists, botanists and zoologists and ornithologists, and background research at various museums and conservation areas as well as to the sacred sites of the indigenous peoples. I am also employing professional translators to assist with my conversations with the indigenous peoples, and also to produce a Spanish language version of the book to be published simultaneously with the English version.

HOW DOES THIS INDIEGOGO.COM PROGRAM WORK?

 While there is a stated 'goal' for this campaign of a modest $5,000, enough buy back the sacred valley for the indigenous peoples and begin rebuilding a traditional village, any excess pledged will be used for the benefit for the indigenous peoples as well. 

PLEASE PLEDGE YOUR SUPPORT TODAY

 Please pledge your support now and participate in this effort to return this sacred land to its rightful owners while also changing young reader's lives and saving the planet by selecting your Thank You gift and your pledge amount from the list on this page. In so doing you will be generously supporting my work here and helping to keep the JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD alive.

 Thank you.
story_txt:
Become a Supporter of the Journey
Exciting news from the Heart of the World - La Sierra Nevada de Santa
Marta in Colombia:


 What started two years ago as a simple project to research and write a
book with the indigenous Elders of Colombia's Sierra Nevada has, not
surprisingly, taken many turns. It has now evolved into a multi-faceted project
that includes the writing of a novel that will share the environmental and
spiritual message of the Elders, plus a feature-length motion picture
adaptation of the book, and now a significant opportunity to help return sacred
lands to the indigenous peoples of the mountain.
 The writing of the book continues and now includes adapting it to form
the basis of a major motion picture that will greatly expand the audience for
the spiritual and environmental message of the Elders.
 I originally intended to live with the indigenous peoples and learn
from them in their villages. That has happened, but now I actually have a group
of indigenous boys - designated future Elders - living with me in my village!
They are attending the local public school to learn more of the world beyond
their world and to learn English so that they can participate in spreading
their spiritual and environmental message.



It Takes a Village
 Recently I had the opportunity of spending some time living with them
in their village - a 'new' village, built in the traditional manner in just the
past few years. The Kogi, Arhuaco and Wiwa peoples are thriving, in spite of
all the pressure to encroach upon their sacred lands and damage our Earth
Mother - la madre tierra.
 Much of their sacred land has been occupied over the years by squatters
- campesinos - farmers who simply moved in and fenced off a part of the sacred
lands and began slash-and-burn deforestation and the planting of commercial
crops.
 While the new tenants have no legal right to the indigenous land they
now occupy, removing them and restoring the land to the indigenous peoples is
not easy.
 I have recently been offered an exceptional opportunity to just that. A
compaseno couple who the indigenous people of the area respect has offered to
turn his land over to the Arhuaco and depart, providing the indigenous with an
opportunity to expand their village and farm the very fertile valley.




 For only the equivalent of four thousand US dollars I can, in effect,
'buy' this entire valley back and return it to its rightful owners, the
indigenous peoples of la Sierra. The purchase price is a small payment for the
extensive improvements that have been made to the property and will ensure that
the property is vacated and returned to the indigenous peoples as a home for
their growing traditional community.
 I am inviting you to participate in this exciting opportunity to right
at least a few of the wrongs that have been vested on the indigenous community
over the past five hundred years. And I promise that I will keep you informed
on all the progress as a new village takes form. In fact, I invite you to come
to Colombia one day and be welcomed into the village yourself, to spend a few
days experiencing the community you have helped create.
 Your small contribution will be used to buy back the land and improvements
and to begin replacing the buildings with new traditional huts and establishing
new traditional farms and gardens.
 Below is an updated version of the original IndieGoGo.com funding
campaign and description. The project has grown significantly since this was
first launched two years ago, but it still gives you an idea of what the
indigenous community and I are hoping to accomplish together.
Do You Believe a Book - and a Movie - Can Change the World? I do.Do you remember reading a special book when you were younger - one that changed your life. I do. If you believe in the power of a book, as I do, I invite you to participate in changing the life of a young reader, maybe thousands of young readers - and in saving the planet - by supporting this very special book - and movie - project.JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD will be an engaging young adult fantasy novel based on a true story. And now it will also be a major motion picture! Christian Castagno is a teenager living in New York when his mother dies of cancer. She leaves behind an illustrated handwritten letter, written when he was conceived, describing the life adventures that await him. Chris tells the story of being led by a talking butterfly, in a series of what may or may not have been dreams, to a mystical mountain in South America where he meets a wise teacher, the elder of a lost tribe of indigenous peoples who fled the coast at the time of Columbus - a people who believe themselves to be the Heart of the World. The spiritual and environmental teachings of the shamanic elder trigger several dream-like heroic adventures through Chris’s past and future lives, including being present as the Spanish conquistadors land on the Colombian coast and participating in conversations between Thomas Edison  and Henry Ford. In the end, the hero comes to understand the true purpose of life and the prescription for saving the life of his endangered Earth Mother.ABOUT THE AUTHOR – JOHN LUNDIN - AND AN UPDATE FROM THE FIELDJohn Lundin with the Mamos of La Sierra Nevada I am the author of THE NEW MANDALA - Eastern Wisdom for Western Living, written in collaboration with His Holiness the Dalai Lama, a book that presented the message of the Buddha to western readers. I have recently been invited by the elders - the Mamos - of the indigenous descendants of the Tairona of the Sierra Nevada in Colombia - people who fled the Spanish invasion in the 1500s and whose culture has remain largely unchanged for five hundred years - to live with them and to learn from them and to write a book that will share their urgent message, the message that our Earth Mother is in trouble and that we are the only ones who can save her. I have chosen to write a young adult fantasy novel, not unlike Harry Potter or Lord of the Rings or The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, one that will appeal to young adult readers since they are the planet's only hope for the future. It will not be a "preachy" book, but it will be an engaging fantasy adventure story with a serious message, one that young people will want to read and one that parents and teachers will encourage them to read.


Update from the field, March 2014: A production company has been formed and is already working on assembling a team to bring the book to the wide screen. The research continues, the teachings from the elders are more intense, and the actual writing of the book is well underway. Several chapters have already been written, and Chapter One of JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF THE WORLD can now be previewed in its entirety at my website, www.JohnLundin.com

story:
Hello I am completely new to this website and the concept of starting up a campaign but here goes.

I will be foremost 100% honest about why this travel experience is so important to me. I do not want to give anyone a sap story about my life and I don't expect anyone to relate but I imagine honesty is the most important thing before anything else. I would like to receive donations/funding to financially aid my travel through Europe and other parts of the world if able.


I have to be blunt. I sincerely feel like this travel experience will help save my life from anymore prolonged despair and help regain hope again.


In order to explain, without writing a novel's worth of a sob story, I will limit this to being as short yet concise as I can. Growing up, I have never had a good childhood, and even now I do not have a strong social circle of friends or family to build enough connections with to travel in the first place. I was raised with an ill single mother all my life due to the early death of my father and have never been able to travel anywhere due to crippling financial and emotional issues. I find it very hard to relate to most people even though I deeply desire to and after constant failure after failure of building solid, meaningful relationships with people, I feel miserable, alone and at this point of my life, hopelessly destitute. If I must be brutally honest once again, I have sunk into a deep depression that has put me in a present situation of serious remorse and anxiety regarding the well-being of my future.


More than anything, I want to escape and be able to further my knowledge and experience life outside of what I have only known. I would love to be able to travel to exotic and foreign places, learn of their culture, and be able to connect and help the locals in the area. I do not want my sense of compassion to be wasted for a single moment because through these activities, I feel that I will have found a sense of achievement and a real meaning in my life. It would be wonderful to be able to have a great group of friends to travel with, but true friendships do not get created from mere wishful thinking; They are created through luck and effort. They are like flowers, and with generous care will bloom and flourish in its beauty or wither away without the right protection. In conclusion, I would love to have this once in a lifetime opportunity through the generosity and understanding of others and along with my dedication, I sincerely wish to believe that this trip will help me regain my hope in life once again.

In return, I would like to provide whatever that is asked of me, in all ways possible within my capabilities. I study art in school and have a passion for drawing. In return, I would like to give all donators, drawings, sketches and paintings I will do while traveling.

Thank you to those who have taken the time to read my story. Peace be with you always~

story:
AU SUJET DE CE PROJET (ABOUT THIS PROJECT)

*ENGLISH VERSION BELOW*

  • POURQUOI

La Chatterie Anglaise est la plus grande chatterie, des 8 chatteries de la SPA Vauclusienne (Isle Sur La Sorgue, France). Environ 120 chats s'y côtoient actuellement, de 1 an à 15 ans, avec des profils différents, des pathologies (ou non) diverses, des histoires plus ou moins particulières, et  cela nécessite donc des BESOINS DIFFERENTS et APPROPRIES pour chacun.

Faute de moyens, la Chatterie Anglaise est devenue un peu le 'fourre-tout' des chatteries, et accueille donc en majorité des profils particuliers tels que des chats craintifs, très timides, bagarreurs, ou avec une pathologie particulière, ou même des groupes de chats errants que le Refuge a sorti de la rue ou de la maltraitance, et qui ont très peu connus le contact humain.

 

Des chats donc, qui ont besoin d'attentions particulières et qui demandent un travail particulier.

 

Hors la structure de la chatterie ne me permet pas d'apporter tout ce que je souhaiterai apporter à mes loulous.

C'est une grande chatterie certes ; il y a de l'espace, un grand extérieur avec des arbres et des intérieurs, mais justement un "trop" d'espace unique pour une multitudes de profils différents qui n'ont pas à être mélangés ensembles.

* A savoir que dans une petite chatterie, un chat très timide, voire craintif, demanderait quelques mois de sociabilisation ; à la Chatterie Anglaise, cela me demande pour certains 1 année, voire 2, voire des chats qui ne progressent pratiquement pas et restent méfiants de l'être humain. Et cela me frustre énormément car mon but et mon souhait, pour chacun, est qu'ils trouvent une famille et un foyer chaleureux.

* Autre problème rencontré par ce grand espace non structuré, et également une autre frustration, c'est lorsqu'un chat doit être soigné et qu'il fait partie de ces chats craintifs et ne se laisse donc pas attraper. S'entame alors une course folle dans le terrain, pendant parfois 20 minutes ou sur plusieurs jours si échecs, engendrant du stress au pauvre loulou.

* Au niveau de certaines pathologies, la chatterie compte quelques loulous qui ont besoin de pâté en plus des croquettes. N'ayant pas d'autres moyens, je fonctionne donc avec le SAS d'entrée de la chatterie pour les mettre à part et pouvoir leur donner tranquillement, mais cela demande toute une organisation, non pratique, qui fait perdre beaucoup de temps, et qui frustrent les autres pauvres loulous qui assistent à la scène et sont également en demande de pâté.

* Le fait, enfin, qu'il s'agisse d'une grande structure avec autant de chats, freine le peu d'éventuelles d'adoptions que nous pouvons déjà y espérer. Combien de fois ai-je entendu : "Il y a trop de chats, je ne sais plus où donner de la tête/ je ne sais pas lequel choisir !", les personnes repartant pour la plupart sans avoir choisi de compagnon.

 

  • DES SOLUTIONS

J'aimerai donc, grâce à votre aide, restructurer la Chatterie en diverses espaces, afin de répondre au mieux aux besoins des loulous, et ainsi de leur donner de réelles chances d'adoption :

* 1 ESPACE SOCIABILISATION/VISITEURS/MISE EN AVANT, qui sera édifié afin d'y accueillir les visiteurs dans un espace plus restreint. Un espace où se côtoieraient des chats sociabilisés ou en cours de sociabilisation (très timides, craintifs, etc..) et permettant ainsi aux plus timides qui ne font jamais la démarche d'aller vers les gens, d'être sociabilisés, de leur redonner confiance en l'être humain, d'êtres vus et mis en avant, et de faire craquer des coeurs par leur douceur et leur gentillesse ..

* 1 ESPACE "BESOINS PARTICULIERS" (Seniors, gingivites etc..), qui sera élaboré afin que nos loulous en besoin d'un régime particulier (pâté, alimentation adaptée..) puissent avoir accès librement et tout le long de la journée (contrairement à actuellement une fois par jour) à une alimentation humide adaptée. Cet espace me permettra également de pouvoir essayer quelques traitements homéopathiques ou phytothérapiques pour le confort de certaines pathologies, et ainsi les stabiliser ; chose que je ne peux absolument pas mettre en place dans les conditions actuelles.

 

COMMENT

Pour la création de ces espaces, il nous faudra donc acheter 1 ou 2 chalets de jardin pour que les chats soient à l'abri, de quoi isoler le(s) chalet(s), de quoi faire une (des) dalle(s) en béton pour y mettre le(s) chalet(s), des portes/ construction de SAS, des arrangements intérieurs/extérieurs (ils auront une partie chalet et une partie terrain), des plaques de recouvrements pour abriter les parties terrains..

 

Si notre but est atteint et même dépassé, l'argent récolté en plus sera utilisé pour tous les autres aménagements/réparations nécessaires dans la chatterie (humidité, besoins en matériels..) ainsi que dans le Refuge .. et il y en a !!

 

COMMENT INDIEGOGO FONCTIONNE : 

Vous décidez combien vous souhaitez contribuer, et choisissez sur votre droite, une Contrepartie associée.

Une fois la campagne terminée, Indiegogo retire 5% de Frais sur la somme atteinte. Si le but n'est pas atteint, les frais s'élèvent alors à environ 9% ! Ce qui est énorme et motive donc grandement à faire un maximum pour y parvenir.

S'ajoutent à ces frais, 3% de frais de traitement pour les cartes de Crédit + 30 cents par transaction, et enfin, 25 dollars de frais de virement (+ ou - selon les banques).


D'AUTRES FACONS D'AIDER :

Vous auriez souhaité nous donner un petit coup de pattes mais ne pouvez pas participer financièrement ? Ne vous en faites pas, il y a toujours un moyen d'aider ! ;)

  • PARTAGEZ un MAX environ une fois par semaine si cela vous est possible (le projet sera alimenté chaque semaine ou presque, avec de nouvelles vidéos, informations etc..) ; vous pouvez utiliser les outils de partage ou copier-coller l'adresse internet du Projet, et les envoyer par E-mail à votre entourage, et partager sur les réseaux sociaux, etc..,
  • PARLEZ-EN autour de vous : famille, amis, entourage, commerçants.. ,
  • Et FAITES UN MAX DE BRUITS pour nous soutenir ! ;D

 

♥ #ThePestouilleProject ♥

 

* ENGLISH VERSION *

 

WHY THIS PROJECT :

L'Anglaise is the biggest cattery, from the 8 catteries of the animal shelter SPA Vauclusienne (Isle Sur La Sorgue, France). About 120 cats currently live there, from 1 year to 15 years old, with different profiles, various pathologies (or not), more or less specific stories, and this therefore requires different and appropriate needs for everyone.

Due to a lack of resources, the English Cattery has become a bit of a cattery 'catch-all', and therefore mostly hosts particular profiles such as fearful cats, very shy, brawlers, or with a particular pathology, or even groups of stray cats that the animal shelter has taken out of the street or abuse, and have very little known human contact.

Cats therefore, who need special attention and who ask for a particular job.

And the structure of the cattery does not allow me to bring all that I wish to bring to my kitties.

It is a great cattery certainly; there is space, a large exterior with trees and interiors, but precisely a "too" unique space for a multitude of different profiles that do not have to be mixed together.

* To know that in a small cattery, a very shy cat, even fearful, would require a few months of socialization; at the cattery L'Anglaise, it requires me for some 1 year, or even 2, even cats that hardly progress and remain suspicious of the human being. And it frustrates me a lot because my goal and wish for everyone is to find a family and a warm home.

* Another problem with this large unstructured space, and also another frustration, is when a cat needs to be cured and is one of those cautious cats and therefore does not get caught. Then begins a crazy race in the field, sometimes for 20 minutes or several days if failures, causing stress to the poor kitty.

* At the level of certain pathologies, the cattery counts some cats which need wet food in addition to dry food. Having no other means, I therefore work with the "SAS" entrance of the cattery to set them apart and be able to give them quietly, but it requires a whole organization, not practical, which is wasting a lot of time, and who frustrate the other poor kitties who attend the scene and are also in demand for pie.

* The fact, finally, that it is a large structure with so many cats, slows down the few possible adoptions that we can already hope for. How many times have I heard: "There are too many cats, I do not know where to turn my head / I do not know which one to choose!", The people leaving for the most part without having chosen a companion.

 

THE SOLUTIONS :


I would like, thanks to your help, to restructure the Cattery in various spaces, in order to best meet the needs of the cats, and thus to give them real chances of adoption:

* 1 SOCIABILIZATION / VISITORS / ADVANCED AREA, which will be built to welcome visitors in a smaller space. A space where sociabilized or socializing cats (very shy, fearful, etc ..) would rub shoulders and thus allowing the shy ones who never make the approach to go to people, to be sociabilized, to give them back confidence in the human being, beings seen and put forward, and to crack hearts by their sweetness and kindness ..

* 1 "PARTICULAR NEEDS" AREA (Seniors, gingivitis etc ..), which will be developed so that our kitties in need of a particular diet (wet food, adapted food ..) can have free access and all the day long ( unlike at present once a day) to a suitable wet diet. This space will also allow me to try some homeopathic or phytotherapic treatments for the comfort of certain pathologies, and thus stabilize them; something that I absolutely can not put in place under the current conditions.

 

HOW :

For the creation of these spaces, we will have to buy 1 or 2 garden cottages so that the cats are safe, what to isolate the (s) cottage (s), what to do a (the) slab (s) ) in concrete to put the (s) cottage (s), doors / construction of SAS, interior / exterior arrangements (they will have part cottage and part ground), plates of coverings to shelter the parts ground ..

If our goal is reached and even exceeded, the money collected in addition will be used for all other adjustments / repairs needed in the cattery (humidity, equipment needs ..) and in the Animal Shelter .. and there are a lot to do ! !

 

HOW INDIEGOGO WORKS : 

You decide how much you want to contribute, then choose an associated perk.

When the campaign ends, IndieGoGo takes a 5% fee off the money we’ve raised.  If we don't reach our goal, the fee is about to 9% .  

Added to theses fees, 3% of processing fee + 30 cents per transaction, and finally, 25 dollars wire fee (+ or - depending the bank).

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP :

You would have liked to give us a little help but can not participate financially ? Do not worry, there is always a way to help! ;)

  • SHARE a MAX about once a week if you can (the project will be powered every week or so, with new videos, informations etc ..); you can use the tools of sharing or copy-paste the Internet address of the Project, and send them by E-mail to your entourage, and share on social networks, etc.,
  • SPEAK about it to family, friends, entourage, traders ..,
  • And MAKE A LOT OF NOISE to support us! ;D

 

♥ #ThePestouilleProject ♥
story_txt:
AU SUJET DE CE PROJET (ABOUT THIS PROJECT)
*ENGLISH VERSION BELOW*
POURQUOI
La Chatterie Anglaise est la plus grande chatterie, des 8 chatteries de la SPA Vauclusienne (Isle Sur La Sorgue, France). Environ 120 chats s'y côtoient actuellement, de 1 an à 15 ans, avec des profils différents, des pathologies (ou non) diverses, des histoires plus ou moins particulières, et  cela nécessite donc des BESOINS DIFFERENTS et APPROPRIES pour chacun.
Faute de moyens, la Chatterie Anglaise est devenue un peu le 'fourre-tout' des chatteries, et accueille donc en majorité des profils particuliers tels que des chats craintifs, très timides, bagarreurs, ou avec une pathologie particulière, ou même des groupes de chats errants que le Refuge a sorti de la rue ou de la maltraitance, et qui ont très peu connus le contact humain.
 
Des chats donc, qui ont besoin d'attentions particulières et qui demandent un travail particulier.
 
Hors la structure de la chatterie ne me permet pas d'apporter tout ce que je souhaiterai apporter à mes loulous.
C'est une grande chatterie certes ; il y a de l'espace, un grand extérieur avec des arbres et des intérieurs, mais justement un "trop" d'espace unique pour une multitudes de profils différents qui n'ont pas à être mélangés ensembles.
* A savoir que dans une petite chatterie, un chat très timide, voire craintif, demanderait quelques mois de sociabilisation ; à la Chatterie Anglaise, cela me demande pour certains 1 année, voire 2, voire des chats qui ne progressent pratiquement pas et restent méfiants de l'être humain. Et cela me frustre énormément car mon but et mon souhait, pour chacun, est qu'ils trouvent une famille et un foyer chaleureux.
* Autre problème rencontré par ce grand espace non structuré, et également une autre frustration, c'est lorsqu'un chat doit être soigné et qu'il fait partie de ces chats craintifs et ne se laisse donc pas attraper. S'entame alors une course folle dans le terrain, pendant parfois 20 minutes ou sur plusieurs jours si échecs, engendrant du stress au pauvre loulou.
* Au niveau de certaines pathologies, la chatterie compte quelques loulous qui ont besoin de pâté en plus des croquettes. N'ayant pas d'autres moyens, je fonctionne donc avec le SAS d'entrée de la chatterie pour les mettre à part et pouvoir leur donner tranquillement, mais cela demande toute une organisation, non pratique, qui fait perdre beaucoup de temps, et qui frustrent les autres pauvres loulous qui assistent à la scène et sont également en demande de pâté.
* Le fait, enfin, qu'il s'agisse d'une grande structure avec autant de chats, freine le peu d'éventuelles d'adoptions que nous pouvons déjà y espérer. Combien de fois ai-je entendu : "Il y a trop de chats, je ne sais plus où donner de la tête/ je ne sais pas lequel choisir !", les personnes repartant pour la plupart sans avoir choisi de compagnon.
 
DES SOLUTIONS
J'aimerai donc, grâce à votre aide, restructurer la Chatterie en diverses espaces, afin de répondre au mieux aux besoins des loulous, et ainsi de leur donner de réelles chances d'adoption :
* 1 ESPACE SOCIABILISATION/VISITEURS/MISE EN AVANT, qui sera édifié afin d'y accueillir les visiteurs dans un espace plus restreint. Un espace où se côtoieraient des chats sociabilisés ou en cours de sociabilisation (très timides, craintifs, etc..) et permettant ainsi aux plus timides qui ne font jamais la démarche d'aller vers les gens, d'être sociabilisés, de leur redonner confiance en l'être humain, d'êtres vus et mis en avant, et de faire craquer des coeurs par leur douceur et leur gentillesse ..
* 1 ESPACE "BESOINS PARTICULIERS" (Seniors, gingivites etc..), qui sera élaboré afin que nos loulous en besoin d'un régime particulier (pâté, alimentation adaptée..) puissent avoir accès librement et tout le long de la journée (contrairement à actuellement une fois par jour) à une alimentation humide adaptée. Cet espace me permettra également de pouvoir essayer quelques traitements homéopathiques ou phytothérapiques pour le confort de certaines pathologies, et ainsi les stabiliser ; chose que je ne peux absolument pas mettre en place dans les conditions actuelles.
 
COMMENT
Pour la création de ces espaces, il nous faudra donc acheter 1 ou 2 chalets de jardin pour que les chats soient à l'abri, de quoi isoler le(s) chalet(s), de quoi faire une (des) dalle(s) en béton pour y mettre le(s) chalet(s), des portes/ construction de SAS, des arrangements intérieurs/extérieurs (ils auront une partie chalet et une partie terrain), des plaques de recouvrements pour abriter les parties terrains..
 
Si notre but est atteint et même dépassé, l'argent récolté en plus sera utilisé pour tous les autres aménagements/réparations nécessaires dans la chatterie (humidité, besoins en matériels..) ainsi que dans le Refuge .. et il y en a !!
 
COMMENT INDIEGOGO FONCTIONNE : 
Vous décidez combien vous souhaitez contribuer, et choisissez sur votre droite, une Contrepartie associée.
Une fois la campagne terminée, Indiegogo retire 5% de Frais sur la somme atteinte. Si le but n'est pas atteint, les frais s'élèvent alors à environ 9% ! Ce qui est énorme et motive donc grandement à faire un maximum pour y parvenir.
S'ajoutent à ces frais, 3% de frais de traitement pour les cartes de Crédit + 30 cents par transaction, et enfin, 25 dollars de frais de virement (+ ou - selon les banques).
D'AUTRES FACONS D'AIDER :
Vous auriez souhaité nous donner un petit coup de pattes mais ne pouvez pas participer financièrement ? Ne vous en faites pas, il y a toujours un moyen d'aider ! ;)


PARTAGEZ un MAX environ une fois par semaine si cela vous est possible (le projet sera alimenté chaque semaine ou presque, avec de nouvelles vidéos, informations etc..) ; vous pouvez utiliser les outils de partage ou copier-coller l'adresse internet du Projet, et les envoyer par E-mail à votre entourage, et partager sur les réseaux sociaux, etc..,

PARLEZ-EN autour de vous : famille, amis, entourage, commerçants.. ,
Et FAITES UN MAX DE BRUITS pour nous soutenir ! ;D

 
♥ #ThePestouilleProject ♥
 
* ENGLISH VERSION *
 
WHY THIS PROJECT :
L'Anglaise is the biggest cattery, from the 8 catteries of the animal shelter SPA Vauclusienne (Isle Sur La Sorgue, France). About 120 cats currently live there, from 1 year to 15 years old, with different profiles, various pathologies (or not), more or less specific stories, and this therefore requires different and appropriate needs for everyone.
Due to a lack of resources, the English Cattery has become a bit of a cattery 'catch-all', and therefore mostly hosts particular profiles such as fearful cats, very shy, brawlers, or with a particular pathology, or even groups of stray cats that the animal shelter has taken out of the street or abuse, and have very little known human contact.
Cats therefore, who need special attention and who ask for a particular job.
And the structure of the cattery does not allow me to bring all that I wish to bring to my kitties.
It is a great cattery certainly; there is space, a large exterior with trees and interiors, but precisely a "too" unique space for a multitude of different profiles that do not have to be mixed together.
* To know that in a small cattery, a very shy cat, even fearful, would require a few months of socialization; at the cattery L'Anglaise, it requires me for some 1 year, or even 2, even cats that hardly progress and remain suspicious of the human being. And it frustrates me a lot because my goal and wish for everyone is to find a family and a warm home.
* Another problem with this large unstructured space, and also another frustration, is when a cat needs to be cured and is one of those cautious cats and therefore does not get caught. Then begins a crazy race in the field, sometimes for 20 minutes or several days if failures, causing stress to the poor kitty.
* At the level of certain pathologies, the cattery counts some cats which need wet food in addition to dry food. Having no other means, I therefore work with the "SAS" entrance of the cattery to set them apart and be able to give them quietly, but it requires a whole organization, not practical, which is wasting a lot of time, and who frustrate the other poor kitties who attend the scene and are also in demand for pie.
* The fact, finally, that it is a large structure with so many cats, slows down the few possible adoptions that we can already hope for. How many times have I heard: "There are too many cats, I do not know where to turn my head / I do not know which one to choose!", The people leaving for the most part without having chosen a companion.
 
THE SOLUTIONS :
I would like, thanks to your help, to restructure the Cattery in various spaces, in order to best meet the needs of the cats, and thus to give them real chances of adoption:
* 1 SOCIABILIZATION / VISITORS / ADVANCED AREA, which will be built to welcome visitors in a smaller space. A space where sociabilized or socializing cats (very shy, fearful, etc ..) would rub shoulders and thus allowing the shy ones who never make the approach to go to people, to be sociabilized, to give them back confidence in the human being, beings seen and put forward, and to crack hearts by their sweetness and kindness ..
* 1 "PARTICULAR NEEDS" AREA (Seniors, gingivitis etc ..), which will be developed so that our kitties in need of a particular diet (wet food, adapted food ..) can have free access and all the day long ( unlike at present once a day) to a suitable wet diet. This space will also allow me to try some homeopathic or phytotherapic treatments for the comfort of certain pathologies, and thus stabilize them; something that I absolutely can not put in place under the current conditions.
 
HOW :
For the creation of these spaces, we will have to buy 1 or 2 garden cottages so that the cats are safe, what to isolate the (s) cottage (s), what to do a (the) slab (s) ) in concrete to put the (s) cottage (s), doors / construction of SAS, interior / exterior arrangements (they will have part cottage and part ground), plates of coverings to shelter the parts ground ..
If our goal is reached and even exceeded, the money collected in addition will be used for all other adjustments / repairs needed in the cattery (humidity, equipment needs ..) and in the Animal Shelter .. and there are a lot to do ! !
 
HOW INDIEGOGO WORKS : 
You decide how much you want to contribute, then choose an associated perk.
When the campaign ends, IndieGoGo takes a 5% fee off the money we’ve raised.  If we don't reach our goal, the fee is about to 9% .  
Added to theses fees, 3% of processing fee + 30 cents per transaction, and finally, 25 dollars wire fee (+ or - depending the bank).
 
OTHER WAYS TO HELP :
You would have liked to give us a little help but can not participate financially ? Do not worry, there is always a way to help! ;)


SHARE a MAX about once a week if you can (the project will be powered every week or so, with new videos, informations etc ..); you can use the tools of sharing or copy-paste the Internet address of the Project, and send them by E-mail to your entourage, and share on social networks, etc.,

SPEAK about it to family, friends, entourage, traders ..,
And MAKE A LOT OF NOISE to support us! ;D

 
♥ #ThePestouilleProject ♥

story:
What is an Angel Tree?

Angel Trees begin to appear during the winter holidays. They inspire hope. They give gifts to children who are less fortunate, who may not have a single present under the tree on Christmas morning. They simply allow you to become Santa for a child in need. 

These trees are dressed in paper ornaments in the shapes of bells or stars and most commonly, angels. They list a child's name, age, and what they are asking Santa for Christmas. Some ask for toys and some ask for clothes. 

Each ornament is designed to be picked up by people like you and I who go out and buy the desired present and turn it in "From Santa" for the child to receive on Christmas morning.

Holiday Angel Tree

Every year, I remove at least one, sometimes two, angels from the Angel Tree. As much as I feel good to be providing two children with presents from santa on Christmas morning, I also feel sad for all the angels left over. All the names with wishes that are left unfufilled. All the smiles that will never happen because they weren't picked. This year, I want to empty as many angel trees as I can.

Give the Gift of Giving

The current goal is set at $500.00. Any and all contributions are helpful. Every penny will go to the presents for the Angels.

The difference a small donation can make is more than one can imagine. Figure, the amount spent on a gift, $10-20, could leave an everlasting impression on a child. That 10 or 20 dollars will bring joy, happiness, hope, faith, to that child's life. Seeing their present under the tree on Christmas morning will bring a bright smile that is worth more than money can buy. A sense of pride. When you think about it, a small amount of money can change someone's life.

If Not Here, Where?

If you decide not to donate to this fundraiser, you can always find an Angel Tree in your hometown and pick out a present yourself. However, I know that some people don't have time to run these extra errands, so why not let me? 

The Perfect Christmas Present

This is something that brings joy to my heart. I have no problem going out and buying the gifts myself. In fact, personally, it would be the best Christmas present I could ever receive.

$25 Gift Card Contest

Upon donating, you will be entered into a contest to win a $25 gift card to any store of your choosing. The winner will be chosen in December, right before Christmas. This is my Christmas present to you :) Thank you for your donations!
