story:
Help Us Get to London for the Conference

Hello! We are Jon and Catrina Huynh-Weiss, high school sweethearts who like to dream big.  In 2011, after a master’s degree program on global politics and climate change at The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), Jon started Lake Climate Group (Lake) -- a climate finance and policy organization aiming simultaneously to address the global climate change and inequality crisis by creating incentivized socio-economic opportunities between developed and developing countries.  Phew!  Jon’s professional background is in-and-around the US Federal government (Congress and Treasury Dept.) and higher education as Director of Strategic Initiatives for Government, Community and Public Affairs for Johns Hopkins Institutions (JHU/JHM). Alongside, Catrina's experience as a television producer for PBS, C-SPAN, Travel Channel and Discovery and as a community development practitioner, she works with Jon to help advance Lake’s mission. 

Our shared dreams for enabling needed and radical change to create a thriving Earth embodies Lake -- an emergent Minneapolis based organization named after our son, Sander Lake.  Lake's model promotes demand driven opportunities to help jointly address the global climate and inequality crisis.

On Monday, September 30th the abstract Jon submitted to Tyndall Center for Climate Change Research and the Royal Society's UK Radical Emission Reduction Conference was accepted for a presentation!  The Royal Society (The National Academy of Science in the UK) is a prestigious 351 year-young scientific organization. We are grateful to be selected to present at this two-day conference from December 10-11, 2013!

Why is funding difficult for our family of three to travel to London? And why are we all going? Our Lake Climate Group, which includes colleagues from around the world, has been focused on establishing itself and therefore has not generated revenue. We work together as a team, bringing different skills, and want to seize this amazing collaborative opportunity with experts from around the world to build increased momentum and garner  exposure and support to make this model a reality. Importantly, we also want our son to experience this unmatched learning opportunity. As passionate climate entrepreneurs we know “doing your dreams” requires having fun, along with very hard work!  And, while we’re optimistic about recent great successes your support of our ability to attend this conference will help us build upon progress. This is an enormous opportunity to advance our locally replicable and globally scalable climate finance model. Your financial support will also facilitate our connecting and collaborating with other conference participants -- academics, practitioners, engineers, economists, policy-makers, and civil society experts -- all aiming to share evidenced-based opportunities for delivering urgent and deep reductions in emissions of greenhouse gases. Ultimately, you’ll also be helping us model to our son what perseverance, collaboration and hope can achieve. Do your dreams!

What We Need ... And Some Perks For You Too!

Our funding campaign request is $3000 (fingers crossed). To travel from Minneapolis to London we will need to purchase airfare for three people and pay for the conference registration for Catrina and Jon. We hope to arrange free lodging with dear friends and take public transportation wherever we go, thanks to the amazing London Tube (Mind the Gap!) and accessible bus routes.

It will cost nearly $2000 to fly to London for the three of us and almost $1000 to register for the conference.  Jon’s mother worked for the airlines and thankfully we can access stand-by airfare prices at discounted rates as a way to reduce airfare costs from $3500 to $1667 for the three of us. Jon says, “Thanks, Mom!” 

The two-day conference registration costs £300, which is approximately $480 x 2, totaling $960. The remainder will go to pay for public transportation costs and food. Our conservative estimates are that we’ll need to spend $30/person/day for food and transportation for 4 days, totaling $360.  

Your contribution matters to us because we want to make this a reality for our family, and hopefully the planet.

Donations can be made through Pay Pal (even without a Pay Pal account set-up) or by credit card. 

If we don’t reach our entire goal of $3000 (gulp), we will explore alternative ways to raise the money needed for this opportunity in London.  

Now, if you choose to donate, you won't leave empty-handed!  We’ve designed five special perk packages just for our supporters, and if you support us at or above the levels we've arranged, you'll receive unique perks from us truly!

If you contribute $10 you will receive Our Eternal Gratitude.  This is a highly coveted prize: Gratitude goes a long ways and it will never die.  It will never fade nor will not wear out.  And it's only $10.  Good kharma makes the perfect gift for any occasion!

If you contribute $25 you'll receive a Postcard from England (though mailed from the US to reduce our carbon footprint!).  We'll ship it right to your door, with a personal note from us.  Our Eternal Gratitude included.

If you contribute $50, you'll get a personalized Video Thank-You from us.  We’ll record it on our iPhone (maybe from London) and send it to you via email.  You'll be able to see the tears of gratitude in our eyes for yourself.  And we mean that seriously.  You're the best.  Also includes Postcard from England (carbon-consciously mailed from the US) and Our Eternal Gratitude.

If you contribute $100, Sander says he’ll be happy to send you a London-inspired artwork made and signed by him.  Hey, I'd donate $100 just for that!  You'll also get a Video Thank-You, a Postcard from England (carbon a-hem...), and Our Eternal Gratitude. 

The Forest by Sander Lake

(Watercolors by Sander Lake)

If you can contribute $250, we’ll send you a half-dozen homemade greeting cards to celebrate any occasion in the new year!  What's more, you'll also get every other perk listed above.  Personalized art-work, a video, a postcard, and many heaping helpings of Our Eternal Gratitude. 

(Examples of homemade cards...)

Thanks very much!

More Details

Curious to know more about Lake Climate Group and our ambitions, please let us know! Send us a note and we'll be happy to contact you in return. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially support our fundraiser, you can still help:

  • Please share our fundraiser with friends and family who you think might be interested in supporting our dream to create a thriving planet. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to make some progressive noise about our campaign.
  • Always consider ways that you can help take care of planet Earth.

Thank you for your time!

(Examples of homemade cards...)





Thanks very much!
More Details

Please share our fundraiser with friends and family who you think might be interested in supporting our dream to create a thriving planet. 
Use the Indiegogo share tools to make some progressive noise about our campaign.
Always consider ways that you can help take care of planet Earth.



Thank you for your time!

story:
Telling the Truth and Solving the Climate Crisis!

FROM OUR FLAGSHIP STATION WPWC 1480 AM IN WASHINGTON DC 

(where this Congress needs to hear it!)

4-6 PM Eastern DAILY!

TO THE WORLD ONLINE (AND IF THIS CAMPAIGN DOES REALLY WELL, ON  XM SIRIUS RADIO) FOR MILLIONS OF AMERICANS TO HEAR!

The "Talk Radio Industry" has been almost completely dominated by those angry loud voices who adamantly deny climate change, ranging from attacking the science itself, the scientists, the scientific consensus, and my favorite; the "global hoax" theory.  These talk radio hosts read from the same script written by "Think Tanks" funded by Big Oil which launched a massive Media and PR campaign to "confuse the American public" on the science two decades ago. They succeeded and "talk radio" played a key role in their success (see the smoking gun memos in the Extra's section).

BUT 20 YEARS LATER TIME IS RUNNING OUT!

Now the Pentagon, the White House, the US National Academy of Sciences, NASA, NOAA, and hundreds of professional organizations like the American Medical Association (AMA), the American Meteorological Society (AMS) are calling for "urgent action" because...

AND WE REALLY NEED THESE GUYS ON RADIO - THE REAL SCIENTISTS, ENTREPRENEURS,COMPANIES AND ACTIVISTS THAT ARE TELLING THE TRUTH AND SOLVING THE CRISIS!

Michael Mann, PhD                                 Jason Box, PhD              Bill McKibben

Peter Sinclair                   Richard Sandor                 Joe Romm

Climate Change is "Here and Now".

Here's the problem: until the American Public understands how high the stakes are, how small the window is, and that the solutions are "here and now" too, we are headed toward a future that is not fit for survival as we know it. It's late, but it's not too late. More extremes are on the way but we can avoid  the nightmare scenerio!

With the 53 million Americans who listen to talk radio, we need to get the truth out and the solutions started. 

On September 21st, the People's Climate March organized the largest climate march in history with 400,000 people in Manhattan and 2600 events held globally. The people marched and so did the UN General Secretary, Al Gore, CEO's like Ikea's CEO Peter Agnefjäll  and their CSO (Chief Sustainability Officer), Steve Howard, and Patagonia's CEO Rose Marcario, celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio and Mark Ruffalo. As the bus captain from Detroit, I was one small part of that. Something felt different, something changed - a tipping point was near. We all pledged to do our part to breach that tipping point, like the Berlin (or Climate) Wall. As a veteran talk radio host who has spent 21 years working on climate change, I now know my part to help breach the wall.  So here we go. We're launching Climate Talk Radio!

So What is Climate Talk Radio? 

A radio talk show hosted by veteran radio host Nancy Skinner with live callers from 4-6 PM Eastern daily which features those on the leading edge of the climate movement from all sectors: top climate scientists, entrepreneurs, market innovators and leading companies, and we will take live callers from across the country.

  • As a long-time radio and TV personality, my style is, uh, a little different. It's smart, witty, compassionate, tough (climate deniers go down in the first round) and very human (this is a bloody serious time in history - so we will cry when disasters strike, laugh when stupidity strikes, and ultimately triumph together). It's compelling mainstream talk radio for listeners who we need to be engaged, asking their leaders to lead (how novel) on the issue - which quite frankly is, well, necessary for our survival. 

ABOUT THE HOST - NANCY SKINNER

Nancy Skinner decided to get into talk radio and set the truth straight on global warming way back in 1997. This after rebuilding flooded communities as models of sustainability, helping launch the Chicago Climate Exchange, and using her Business Degree from the Univeristy of Michigan, she determined that public opinion was the frontline of this "war on the science". She was a host for 8 years on WLS Radio in Chicago, a nationally syndicated co-host on 465 stations, and her own show on 81 stations. She was a regular substitute on stations like Boston's WRKO, New York's WOR and Chicago's WGN, where her "Climate Change Believer" status was a rare minority. Nancy just became a Member of Climate Reality's Leadership Corps, trained by Al Gore in Rio November. 


Featuring the Best Production and Contributors on Climate Change in the World!

Peter Sinclair 

Joining me in the production is veteran Videographer and Climate Denier De-bunker, Peter Sinclair, who runs the website www.climatecrocks.com and is the Media Director on the International Dark Snow project, where he just returned from his second expedition to the Greenland Ice Sheets. 

The show already has contributors signed up from the world's leading scientists (and we will let them talk without cutting them off after 4 seconds). 

SHOW CONTRIBUTORS - FROM REAL CLIMATE SCIENTISTS, TO TECHNOLOGY AND MARKET GURUS TO CELEBRITIES AND POLITICIANS

Michael E. Mann, PhD

Distinguished Professor of Meteorology and Director of Earth Systems Science Center at Penn State University. Dr. Michael E. Mann received his undergraduate degrees in Physics and Applied Math from the University of California at Berkeley, an M.S. degree in Physics from Yale University, and a Ph.D. in Geology & Geophysics from Yale University. He contributed, with other IPCC authors, to the award of the 2007 Nobel Peace Prize.  
Michael authored “The Hockey Stick Chart and Climate Wars” and was at the center of the so-called bogus “Climate-Gate”. 

Jason Eric Box, PhD

Professor in glaciology at the Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland. He was for 10 years (2002-2012) at Byrd Polar Research Center at Ohio State University, eventually a tenured physical climatology and geography associate professor in the department of geography. He is also one of the members of the team doing field work for the Extreme Ice Survey and has led the Dark Snow Project, the first Internet crowd-funded Arctic expedition. 

He played a lead role in the  work for the Emmy-nominated “Chasing Ice” documentary and was recently featured on Real Time with Bill Maher. 

Bill McKibben - Founder 350.org

The Boston Globe called him "probably America's most important environmentalist." Bill McKibben is an author and environmentalist, whose 1989 book, The End of Nature. is regarded as the first book for a general audience about climate change, and has appeared in 24 languages. He is founder of 350.org, the first planet-wide, grassroots climate change movement, including a driving force behind the People’s Climate March in NYC. The Schumann Distinguished Scholar in Environmental Studies at Middlebury College and a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences, he was the 2013 winner of the Gandhi Prize and the Thomas Merton Prize, and holds honorary degrees from 18 colleges and universities; Foreign Policy named him to their inaugural list of the world's 100 most important global thinkers. Rolling Stones Magazine published his article, Global Warming’s Terrifying New Math in 2012, renewed the urgency of the Climate Crisis.

Joe Romm, PhD - Founder, Climate Progress Blog

Joe Romm is a Fellow at American Progress and is the Founding Editor of Climate Progress, which New York Times columnist Tom Friedman called "the indispensable blog" and Time magazine named one of the 25 "Best Blogs of 2010." In 2009,Rolling Stones put Romm #88 on its list of 100 "people who are reinventing America."Time named him a "Hero of the Environment″ and “The Web’s most influential climate-change blogger." Romm was acting assistant secretary of energy for energy efficiency and renewable energy in 1997, where he oversaw $1 billion in R&D, demonstration, and deployment of low-carbon technology. He is a Senior Fellow at American Progress and holds a Ph.D. in physics from MIT.

TO MARKETS & TECHNOLOGY EXPERTS

Richard Sandor

Former President, Chicago Board of Trade, Founder Chicago Climate Exchange, Ph.D, Dr., Sc.h.c.

Richard L. Sandor is chairman and chief executive officer of Environmental Financial Products LLC, which specializes in inventing, designing, and developing new financial markets with a special emphasis on investment advisory services. EFP was established in 1998 and was the predecessor company and incubator to the Chicago Climate Exchange (CCX), the European Climate Exchange (ECX) and the Chicago Climate Futures Exchange (CCFE). He is also the author of Good Derivatives: A Story of Financial and Environmental Innovation, published in 2012, and as the former President of Chicago Board of Trade, is known nationally as the "father of interest rate futures". 

"Climate Talk Radio" might sound like a narrow topic, but in reality, it touches almost every aspect of our lives from A to Z (and more). 

Climate Talk Radio (CTR) is not your typical NPR “preach to the choir” show. The choir was in the streets of Manhattan. They get it - we've got about ten years to get this right, and we can do it! Renewable energy costs have plummeted, crazy technology breakthroughs are happening every day. Major companies are taking the lead down the carbon-neutral path and CEO's of some of the largest companies were marching right alongside us in Manhattan. People are beginning to connect the dots on freakishly extreme weather, and we will make it even more clear (something the mainstream media has flunked on frankly). When 400,000 people from all 50 states take to the streets with, 2600 global events, and the national media coverage was a collective shrug, then we need to keep the megaphone turned on!

The multi-media show (Streaming Net, the Mobile and Tablet Apps, and streaming HD Video, then more terrestrial radio stations and satellite radio as we grow) will be live and cover real "Breaking News" and a myriad of topics with top name guests: top scientists, entrepreneurs, CEO's and CSO's (Chief Sustainability Officer's) of companies reducing their carbon footprint, student leaders, and organizations on the front lines. CTR will be going to places all over the globe to really see the wreckage climate change is already causing and the human toll, noting which nations are kicking butts and taking names on renewable energy and where the "smart money" is going on Wall Street (hint it's not into coal plants). 

BUT THE DIFFERENCE IS YOU - THE LIVE CALLERS FROM ALL 50 STATES!

The key ingrediant is that CTR will take live callers. You need to speak your peace, ask questions, deniers will have their shot (but good luck with that) and although I like podcasts (and will have them), ultimately, it will take interaction with ordinary Americans to truly bring them up to speed on the science, the urgency, and make Climate Talk Radio rise above the noise the deniers have been putting out for 20 years!

So what does Climate Talk Radio sound like? Is it boring? (No Way!!)

CLIMATE TALK RADIO DEMO (# 1- Midterms brings the Big Climate Change Questions to the Big Debates and the Answers were uh...Interesting)

CLIMATE TALK RADIO DEMO (# 2- A caller defends comical reporting by a Weather Channel "Weathercaster" on how 21 degrees above normal in October is something everyone loves - "who doesn't?" And how does that work out in July for ya?)


UPDATE: Since this denier used John Coleman, Co-founder of the Weather Channel as his defense of the big climate hoax, the Weather Channel released a powerful statement rebuking him. 

Read all about it in Peter Sinclair's (our Climate Media Director at Climate Talk Radio) latest post. 

Weather Channel Humiliates Climate Denier John Coleman (Again) from www.ClimateCrocks.com.

If you think I'm afraid to speak truth to power...I was on Fox News defending the Climate Scientist's being smeared by the fake "Climategate Email Scandal" evoking shock because I "insulted" Rush Limbaugh's gross mischaractures, but calling out a shill for the climate denial industry, priceless. (See the video in the Extra's Video Gallery). 

What We Need & What You Get

  • But it all starts with a simple radio show. We need the basic radio equipment to broadcast and stream remotely, from wherever I am, and to produce, broadcast and air the show at our Flagship Station, 1480 AM in Washington DC from 4-6 PM daily 

    in the nation's capital Washington. 

    Imagine every cab driver in DC with Climate Talk Radio on their radio!

  • Since it is multi-media and interactive show and uses social media to support climate-friendly companies (and save money doing so) and to influence mainstream media and politicians, we will need the funds to build and run an awesome website (really a webtool) and a phone and tablet app. 

Members of Congress will be blasted on radio with something refreshing about climate change: THE TRUTH!


Look out Antiques Road Show , The Climate Road Show will unearth more hidden treasures, find the truth, and separate it from the 'junk radio" that has been crying "junk science" for far too long. 

First stop. Rio De Janeiro. 

I've was accepted into Climate Reality's Leadership Corps. and attended the training, led by Al Gore himself and other experts in Rio November 4th-6th. After reading Al Gore's book in fact, Earth in the Balance I decided to use my Business Degree from the University of Michigan to get into this brand new field called "sustainable development"? So I am now a Member of the Climate Reality Leadership Corps and available to present his famous slide presentation. 
I also interviewed a Brazilian legend who helped organize the famous Rio Summit, Dr. Israel Klabin, while in Rio, and now runs the Brazilian Institute for Sustainable Development and is playing a major role in upcoming UN negotiations. 

CLIMATE REALITY LEADERSHIP CORPS TRAINING WITH AL GORE IN RIO                                               


  • Be Super Cool - with a Climate Talk Radio T-Shirt 

  • Pitch in for a Poster - Get a print to frame for your office, or for your favorite climate denier. They will love it! Posters come with (or without) autographs. 
 

Take it with you everywhere - CTR the App. on your phone or tablet.


The app that helps you support climate friendly companies and save money with "Climate Coupons" when you do! 

You can always listen live to CTR, get archived shows and podcasts on your smartphone or tablet, but with your CTR app, you get last minute deals from companies when you are signed up to Climate Coupons on your app. There are growing numbers of companies that are moving down the carbon neutral path and help speed the transition as sustainable enterprises. They need our consumer support and we save money by creating volume. This will help other companies to wake up and smell the carbon!

AND OUR STRETCH CAMPAIGNS ONLY BUILD ON THE RADIO SHOW AND EXPAND OUR MEDIA REACH ACROSS THE GLOBE.

  • From the first radio station in DC, to XM Sirius, to additional terrestrial radio stations and then onto HD Video Coverage of the show. With new mobile video production equipment, Climate Talk Radio will be a TV show as polished as any network show online or ready for a national TV network. Everything is possible after we get up and running our basic radio show on one key radio station, your phone and tablet. 

Let's Put the Heat on by REALLY covering the UN Talks! 

LIMA PERU DECEMBER 2014

PARIS NOVEMBER 2015 


The Impact of Climate Talk Radio 
We are indeed at a tipping point in public opinion. People can see climate extremes with their own eyes, from Atlanta's ice storms, to Alaska's balmy 60 degree winter, to Australia's blazing 125 degree summers. California is in a 500-yr. drought, Michigan broke all snowfall records last winter and has had sustained extreme downpours and flooding this summer.  Hurricanes and tropical storms on both coasts and massive storm systems putting 40 million people in its path this summer. This ain't normal friends. 

Media has a major impact on public opinion (which affects policymakers) and national media has continued to focus on political food fights, celebrity nonsense, and crisises like Ebola and ISIS, which are real,  but will affect far fewer people than the hundreds of millions that will be affected and displaced by sea level rise, weather extremes, and the extraordinary costs to our nation's economy. They continue to act like the "jury is out" or there are two sides that carry equal weight and stage "faux debates", when that nonsense should have ended many many years ago. It's time our voices are heard so Americans can choose to continue down a "business as usual" path (which pretty much means game over), or choose to embrace the innovation, ingenuity and fortitude of the American spirit and "bend history". 

Risks & Challenges
Make no mistake, the fossil fuel interests like the Koch Brothers, will not like Climate Talk Radio because they have poured millions into media and the political system to keep the public confused, the politicians paralyzed, and zero action on climate change. 

The People's Climate March changed everything. People will fund Climate Talk Radio. CEO's of companies who marched alongside us on September 21st are companies well on their way to being carbon neutral will help us grow. Confused Americans will be Informed Americans demanding that their policymakers take action and embrace clean renewable energy technologies. Climate Talk Radio listeners will make clear to companies that they expect "sustainability" to be as important as next quarters profits (and will find that in fact it improves the bottom line). 


IT'S A GOOD THING I'M A WAR-TESTED VETERAN IN THE MEDIA WARS BECAUSE THE MEDIA NEEDS TO GROW SOME OVARIES ON CLIMATE CHANGE AND CALL IT LIKE IT IS!

And if you think I'm afraid to speak truth to power...I was on Fox News defending the Climate Scientist's being smeared by the fake "Climategate Email Scandal". Evoking shock because I "insulted" Rush Limbaugh's gross mischaractures, Calling out a shill for the climate denial industry, priceless. (See the video in the Extra's Video Gallery). 

    IT WAS NOT NPR, IT WAS NOT THE CHOIR, IT WAS "TALK RADIO" 

    I've been working on Climate Change for 21 years now from about every platform available: Presidential Award winning Activist who spearheaded the rebuilding of two flooded towns as models of sustainability in 1993, to helping launch the Chicago Climate Exchange (yes - cap and trade model), to pioneering progressive radio back in 1997 because Climate Denying hosts like Rush Limbaugh and all his clones spread the well-funded disinformation campaign to "confuse the public" on the science and consensus on climate change, to running three times for congress on the issue of Climate Change (and boy were they colorful)...

    Nancy Skinner, the Politician 

    First Race: Lost to POTUS (then a little-known state senator named Barack Obama) in the Illinois US Senate Primary in 2004. He ran on healthcare. I ran on climate change. Barack Obama (yes - I lost to POTUS, but what a cool honor that was and he "heartily endorsed me" during my 2006 race. 

    Second Race: Nearly upset a 14 yr. incumbent in 2006. Robert Kennedy Jr. did my TV Endorsement Ads. 

    Third Race: Narrowly lost in a three-way primary August 5th of this year. Once again, I ran on climate change. 

    July 21st, 2014 

    This Congressional Candidate Isn’t Running From Climate Change, She’s Running On It

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Offer up your skills: design, animation, videos, blog posts. It's an international project. Think Big!
    • Use all the Indiegogo Share Tools and all your Email Lists and Social Media Skills to make Climate Talk Radio go Viral. ("Like" Climate Talk Radio on Facebook and our You Tube Channel. Follow @Climatetalker (Nancy) on Twitter and invite your friends too. 
    • If you have any questions, email me at nancy@climatetalkradio.com. 

    And that's all there is to it. Let's stop the lies and let the solutions begin!

Telling the Truth and Solving the Climate Crisis!




FROM OUR FLAGSHIP STATION WPWC 1480 AM IN WASHINGTON DC 



(where this Congress needs to hear it!)
4-6 PM Eastern DAILY!
TO THE WORLD ONLINE (AND IF THIS CAMPAIGN DOES REALLY WELL, ON  XM SIRIUS RADIO) FOR MILLIONS OF AMERICANS TO HEAR!



The "Talk Radio Industry" has been almost completely dominated by those angry loud voices who adamantly deny climate change, ranging from attacking the science itself, the scientists, the scientific consensus, and my favorite; the "global hoax" theory.  These talk radio hosts read from the same script written by "Think Tanks" funded by Big Oil which launched a massive Media and PR campaign to "confuse the American public" on the science two decades ago. They succeeded and "talk radio" played a key role in their success (see the smoking gun memos in the Extra's section).


BUT 20 YEARS LATER TIME IS RUNNING OUT!

Now
the Pentagon, the White House, the US National Academy of Sciences, NASA, NOAA,
and hundreds of professional organizations like the American Medical
Association (AMA), the American Meteorological Society (AMS) are calling for "urgent action" because...

AND WE REALLY NEED THESE GUYS ON RADIO - THE REAL SCIENTISTS, ENTREPRENEURS,COMPANIES AND ACTIVISTS THAT ARE TELLING THE TRUTH AND SOLVING THE CRISIS!

Michael Mann, PhD                                 Jason Box, PhD              Bill McKibben 



Peter Sinclair                   Richard Sandor                 Joe Romm



Climate Change is "Here and Now".



Here's the problem: until the American Public understands
how high the stakes are, how small the window is, and that the solutions are
"here and now" too, we are headed toward a future that is not fit for
survival as we know it. It's late, but it's not too late. More extremes are on the way but we can avoid  the nightmare scenerio!


With the 53 million Americans who
listen to talk radio, we need to get the truth out and the solutions
started. 


On September 21st, the People's Climate March organized the largest
climate march in history with 400,000 people in Manhattan and 2600 events
held globally. The people marched and so did the UN General Secretary, Al Gore,
CEO's like Ikea's CEO Peter
Agnefjäll  and their CSO (Chief Sustainability Officer), Steve
Howard, and Patagonia's CEO Rose Marcario, celebrities like Leonardo
DiCaprio and Mark Ruffalo. As the bus captain from Detroit, I was one
small part of that. Something felt different, something changed - a tipping
point was near. We all pledged to do our part to breach that tipping point, like the Berlin (or Climate) Wall. As a veteran talk radio host who has spent 21 years
working on climate change, I now know my part to help breach the wall.  So here we go. We're
launching Climate Talk Radio!




So What is Climate Talk Radio? 

A radio talk show hosted by veteran radio host Nancy Skinner with live callers from 4-6 PM Eastern daily which features those on the leading edge of the climate movement from all sectors: top climate scientists, entrepreneurs, market innovators and leading companies, and we will take live callers from across the country.
As a long-time radio and TV personality, my style is, uh, a little different. It's smart, witty, compassionate, tough (climate deniers go down in the first round) and very human (this is a bloody serious time in history - so we will cry when disasters strike, laugh when stupidity strikes, and ultimately triumph together). It's compelling mainstream talk radio for listeners who we need to be engaged, asking their leaders to lead (how novel) on the issue - which quite frankly is, well, necessary for our survival. 

ABOUT THE HOST - NANCY SKINNER
Nancy Skinner decided to get into talk radio and set the truth straight on global warming way back in 1997. This after rebuilding flooded communities as models of sustainability, helping launch the Chicago Climate Exchange, and using her Business Degree from the Univeristy of Michigan, she determined that public opinion was the frontline of this "war on the science". She was a host for 8 years on WLS Radio in Chicago, a nationally syndicated co-host on 465 stations, and her own show on 81 stations. She was a regular substitute on stations like Boston's WRKO, New York's WOR and Chicago's WGN, where her "Climate Change Believer" status was a rare minority. Nancy just became a Member of Climate Reality's Leadership Corps, trained by Al Gore in Rio November. 




Featuring the Best Production and Contributors on Climate Change in the World!
Peter Sinclair 



Joining me in the production is veteran Videographer and Climate Denier De-bunker, Peter Sinclair, who runs the website www.climatecrocks.com and is the Media Director on the International Dark Snow project, where he just returned from his second expedition to the Greenland Ice Sheets.

And if you think I'm afraid to speak truth to power...I was on Fox News defending the Climate Scientist's being smeared by the fake "Climategate Email Scandal". Evoking shock because I "insulted" Rush Limbaugh's gross mischaractures, Calling out a shill for the climate denial industry, priceless. (See the video in the Extra's Video Gallery). 



IT WAS NOT NPR, IT WAS NOT THE CHOIR, IT WAS "TALK RADIO" 
I've been working on Climate Change for 21 years now from about every platform available: Presidential Award winning Activist who spearheaded the rebuilding of two flooded towns as models of sustainability in 1993, to helping launch the Chicago Climate Exchange (yes - cap and trade model), to pioneering progressive radio back in 1997 because Climate Denying hosts like Rush Limbaugh and all his clones spread the well-funded disinformation campaign to "confuse the public" on the science and consensus on climate change, to running three times for congress on the issue of Climate Change (and boy were they colorful)...
Nancy Skinner, the Politician 
First Race: Lost to POTUS (then a little-known state senator named Barack Obama) in the Illinois US Senate Primary in 2004. He ran on healthcare. I ran on climate change. Barack Obama (yes - I lost to POTUS, but what a cool honor that was and he "heartily endorsed me" during my 2006 race. 



Second Race: Nearly upset a 14 yr. incumbent in 2006. Robert Kennedy Jr. did my TV Endorsement Ads. 


Third Race: Narrowly lost in a three-way primary August 5th of this year. Once again, I ran on climate change. 




July 21st, 2014 
This Congressional Candidate Isn’t Running From Climate Change, She’s Running On It




Other Ways You Can Help

 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: 
Offer up your skills: design, animation, videos, blog posts. It's an international project. Think Big! Use all the Indiegogo Share Tools and all your Email Lists and Social Media Skills to make Climate Talk Radio go Viral. ("Like" Climate Talk Radio on Facebook and our You Tube Channel. Follow @Climatetalker (Nancy) on Twitter and invite your friends too. 
If you have any questions, email me at nancy@climatetalkradio.com.  
 And that's all there is to it. Let's stop the lies and let the solutions begin!

story:
Short Summary

Juan Carlos an I (Gabriel) are the co-founding partners of Siempre Verde. We are two brothers that are both passionate about the environment and share a love of trees. We try to spend time outdoors at every chance we get!

Faced with the facts:

· Mexico currently has the 7th largest annual net loss of forest area (FAO 2010)

· The population of Mexico consumes 2 million Christmas trees annually (USDA Foreign Agricultural Service, GAIN Report, 2012)

So we decided to start Siempre Verde!

Siempre Verde runs an environmental program that aims to substitute the consumption of cut-down Christmas trees with a more sustainable alternative. We offer customers a living Christmas tree with it's roots inside of a pot. We deliver the trees to each home and then return after the holidays to pick-up the living tree. We reforest all re-collected trees to reduce unnecessary logging and generate a large-scale reforestation program.


What We Need & What You Get

Siempre Verde was recently selected form a large number of applicants to participate in Agora Partnerships' 2014 Accelerator Program. Agora's mission is to accelerate the success of early stage entrepreneurs committed to building businesses that create shared value and address critical and social challenges. The Agora Accelerator is an intensive program designed to give Entrepreneurs access to the knowledge, networks, and capital they need to succeed.

We need US$7,000 (seven thousand dollars) to pay the tuition fees and travel expenses associated with the Agora program. This acceleration program is very important to Siempre Verde because it will provide us with the individual business consulting we need to grow our business. In particular, the program will help us build a tool-kit that will enable us to develop a system of metrics that we can use to track, measure, increase and communicate Siempre Verde’s environmental and social impact.


We really need your help to participate in this amazing program. In case you need an additional incentive, please look at the great perks that we are offering in return for your very generous donations.

·  For $10.00 you get a Thank You! With our most since gratitude

·  For $25.00 we will plant and take care of a tree in your name. You can name the tree and we´ll send you a picture

· For $50.00 we will plant and take care of a tree in your name. You can name the tree and we'll send you a picture of the tree every year, so you can follow your tree’s growth

· For $100.00 we will plant and take care of a tree in your name. You can name the tree and we'll send you a picture of the tree every year, so you can follow your tree's growth, and we will also send you a Siempre Verde T-shirt

·  For $250.00 you get a double pass to one of our reforestations. You and your significant other will get to take place in one of the most memorable stages of the project, the reforestation. You + 1, together with Siempre Verde’s team and other enthusiasts will participate re-planting the trees in what will become their definitive home

·  For $500.00 you get a special dinner for two, at Mexico’s best Italian cuisine restaurant. You’ll dine with Siempre Verde’s co-founder’s in a turn-of-the-century French-style mansion that has been lovingly renovated

We are confident that you’ll help us reach our goal! However, if we are not been able to raise 100% of the funds in 30 days, we will use the portion we have been able to raise to get us closer to participate in the program.

Our Impact So Far

Siempre Verde has three main objectives:

  • Environmental impact
        - Avoid unnecessary loss of forest area

        - Engage society in the construction of forests one tree at a time

        - Preserve forests as chief carbon sinks and important home to wildlife

  • Social development

       - Generate more, higher-paid jobs year-round

       - Train Mexican Christmas trees farmers in the production of higher quality, more resilient Christmas trees & more accurate unearthing techniques

  • Economic sustainability

       - Capture 5% of Mexico's total Christmas tree market share by 2018

       - Continue converting cut down Christmas tree customers to live Christmas tree customers

Siempre Verde tested out the concept in 2010 and sold 2,000 living Christmas trees in three days. Once we had proven the concept, we sold 4,000 living Christmas trees in 2011 and 4,500 living Christmas trees in 2012. The trees from 2010 and 2011 have been reforested in a natural protected area in Puebla, Pue., Mexico and have a survival rate higher than 80%. The trees from 2012 were reforested in collaboration with the local Ministry of Environment ("SEDEMA") and the Mexico City Administration ("GDF") during the 2013 rainy season (survival rates will be gathered in 2014).

THE CHRISTMAS TREE INDUSTRY: PLENTY OF ROOM FOR SIEMPRE VERDE TO CREATE IMPACT

Annual worldwide Christmas tree consumption is close to 100 million (breakdown below).

  • Mexico - 2 million (USDA Foreign Agricultural Service, GAIN Report, 2012)
  • USA – 33 million (USDA National Agricultural Statistics Service, 2012)
  • Canada – 6 million (Census of Agriculture Statistics Canada, 2012)

  • Europe – 50 million (Chastagner, Gary A. and Benson, D. Michael. The Christmas Tree: Traditions, Production and Diseases, Plant Management Network International, October 13, 2001)

We believe that our proposed solution has the potential to create enormous impact worldwide. If we were able to standardize both unearthing techniques and tree survival rates at 85%, there would be an annual 85,000 ha of new reforested areas. That is equal to the daily oxygen requirement of 3,780,702 people.


The US Christmas tree industry employs 100,000 people (USDA National Agricultural Statistics Service, 2012) and the US market represents one third of total Christmas tree consumption.  Unearthing a tree is more labor intensive than cutting it down, therefore 150,000 additional jobs could be created if all Christmas tree markets used the Siempre Verde method.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like Siempre Verde, but for some reason you are not able to contribute with a donation, you can still help us spread the word! We need people to start making healthier, more sustainable choices in their everyday life. Siempre Verde is the smart way to celebrate Christmas.

story:
KoalaTracker Background

Regardless of the evidence showing both the significant loss of koala populations and the economic value of the koala to Australian tourism, governments at every level over a number of decades, have failed to act to save this harmless, defenceless, beautiful animal.

Milions of dollars have been raised by lobbying groups, but this has failed to save the koala.

Today, there are localised extinctions; where small populations remain, they cling to life in over-developed urban environments, or pockets of forest now isolated by highways, cleared farm land and housing estates, their narrow gene pool further exacerbating risks to their viability. 

Extinction in my lifetime is a real possibility. The answers to three simple questions are critical to reversing this trend: 

  1. How many are left?
  2. Where do they live?
  3. In what condition, with what issues?

But not a single government agency, lobbying or conservation group could answer any one of those questions. Location information, health and points of impact is critical to public infrastructure decisions, development, risk mitigation and koala conservation.

Yet to-date, every single one of the koala habitat maps used for public policy and public debate have been determined by pixel color on satellite images. 

However accurate the technology - and there is much evidence to question the accuracy - these maps are not about the location of koalas. They are about the location of trees. 

The koala was finally listed as vulnerable under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act on April 30th, 2012,  in the states of Queensland, New South Wales, and Australian Capital Territory only.

Listing was assessed and rejected in 1996 and again in 2006. The Threatened Species Scientific Committee recommended against it again last year. 

The reason? Despite the marked decline in populations, the “body of data on koala populations is patchy, often sparse and not nationally comprehensive or coordinated.” (QWeekend, April 14-15, 2012)

 

Crowdsourcing Koala Location Intelligence

I self-funded the creation of a national crowdsourced koala map: www.koalatracker.com.au, launched in February, 2010.   

KoalaTracker.com.au is Australia’s national crowdsourced koala map, recording location intelligence of koala populations in (for the most part) the urban wild, actual points of impact, and causes of death and injury for the public record, as submitted by concerned citizens. Anyone can access this map, the database, the photos.

Membership to the site is free, the database searchable, the database, map and photos free to use for non-commercial purposes. 

We bulldoze the life out of vast tracts of koala forest for endless housing developments, oblivious to the fact remnant populations of koalas remain. It might not appear to be koala habitat from space, it certainly may not be high value habitat, but this is where koalas live. And die. 

See the photo gallery on this campaign for photos of the map and impacts.

KoalaTracker shows the impacts are cars, dogs and disease. Clearing and fragmenting habitat (where the koalas live) and forcing koalas on the ground to traverse roads and yards to find more food or mates; putting koala populations under extreme stress, causing malnutrition and susceptibility to disease; isolating populations, weakening the gene pool and immune system.

All of these risks can be mitigated, if we know where the koalas live, and where these impacts are ocurring. 

What we needed was a map to show where koalas were living in the wild; a map that showed us what was decimating the population, and whereabouts. 

What the koala needed was community engagement. It needed someone to tell the stories, to give koalas a voice in the decision making.

KoalaTracker puts that and more, on the public record. Bob Irwin, lifelong wildlife advocate and father of Steve Irwin, Crocodile Hunter, describes it as exceptional.

KoalaTracker proves the government maps are wrong. It engages the community in koala conservation; it inspires them to report sightings, to call rescue groups when they see an injured koala, and to act on the koala's behalf in their own neighbourhoods. 

It provides visual evidence of the movement of koalas across major roads seeking food; it shows the details of domestic dog attacks; the incidence of disease in distinct population groupings. All of this is invaluable not just to a handful of researchers or government officers - but to all of us. 

It delivers unexpected information too, such as historical sightings data, and most exciting, uncommon, if not unknown information...such as koalas drinking water, swimming (in the sea and in rivers), eating flowers and bark, eating non-eucalypt leaves such as paperbark, macadamia and camphor laurel leaves, and termite dirt. And did I mention, spectacular photography of koalas in the wild?

It may be citizen science, but it shows how little we really know about this smart, adaptable and simply adorable animal. KoalaTracker is accurate, it is national, it is comprehensive, and it is free.

Mapping the location of alive, dead and injured koalas, with causes, dates and details, empowers the community in advocacy for specific areas; it enables effective risk mitigation by local government in terms of signage, fencing, lighting, speed zones and more; it provides the necessary foundation of facts for informed public policy and infrastructure planning at every level of government; it ensures informed corporate and community decisions, and empowers communities to watch, and watch out for their resident koalas.



Who Am I? Who Is Behind KoalaTracker?

Hi, I’m Alex. A professional corporate communications strategist experienced in delivering public relations, issues management, digital and social media strategy for publicly listed companies, private companies and not-for-profit organisations. I’m also a believer in the value of technology to solve problems. I earn a living here: www.digitalpublishingaustralia.com.au. 

I created KoalaTracker.com.au at my own expense. Tools and technology were purchased; some 300 hours in development and 1,000+ hours since in maintaining the site donated, and it costs $70 per month just to keep it online. At a personal cost of $150,000 to-date, I can no longer do this alone. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

KoalaTracker.com.au receives no government funding, no corporate support, no licensing fees. No money whatsoever from any other source except my now much depleted personal bank account.  

And now after now more than two years, KoalaTracker.com.au needs an upgrade. The aim is to enhance the reporting function and to automate the data transfer to map (yes, folks, I do this manually). 

I need just $1,500 to upgrade the database and reporting function, a further $1,200 to automate the map update, and will gratefully accept anything more you can give to alleviate annual hosting fees ($840), and cover maintenance and my time so that I can keep KoalaTracker.com.au going, and keep it free.  

So, I'm aiming for $3,500 and hoping you can help get me there. See the perks at right.

 

How Else Can you Help?

If you can’t donate money, can you buy a tote bag or T-shirt from the KoalaTracker shop ($5 from every purchase goes to KoalaTracker.com.au)?

Better still, hire me for a paid project with your company, or book me to speak at your corporate event! See my personal profile here www.about.me/alex.harris. 

Follow me on Twitter (www.twitter.com/koalatracker) and spread the word about www.KoalaTracker.com.au AND this fundraising project on Indiegogo. 

Put a link to www.koalatracker.com.au on your own website, share it on Facebook. Tell your friends, show them the site. Tell your school. Get your kids and your gardening group involved.

We need more people to use it. Especially, more rescue groups reporting deaths and injuries. Tell your friends. Tell your local rescue group you want them to use KoalaTracker.com.au.

Remember, you do not have to be reporting sightings to get value from www.KoalaTracker.com.au.

Most of all, I hope you do join and use KoalaTracker.com.au. 

Because the more data we collect, the more valuable and indisputable the evidence becomes. 

Because with every new member we prove a global population that is concerned about and cares for the future of the koala. And more importantly, a population that is actually doing something to save the koala. 

Thank you!

story:
About the Project

During the last 15 years that I’ve been writing about the environment, I’ve watched an energy transition take place. First, I started out writing about mountaintop removal mining in Appalachia, then fracking in the Marcellus and across the West, then the Keystone XL pipeline, and now plans for oil and tar sands mining in Utah near some of my most beloved places on Earth. 

A war over energy is being fought in backyards across the country as millions of Americans are being impacted. The era of cheap and easy energy is over. Now, the price is higher and so are the stakes.

I've talked to people all across the country who have seen their neighborhoods turned into industrial zones because of extreme extraction and they are scared. It not only locks us into a future of catastrophic climate change, but is already endangering our health, our communities, our food, precious resources like water, and the safety of workers in virtually every state in the country.

If we are going to have any hope of breaking the political divide that stymies progress on environmental issues, we are going to have to understand the personal aspect of our energy decisions. I decided to launch Hitting Home to chronicle the growing number of moving personal stories that can shift the debate on energy. 

The Nitty Gritty

I plan to spend three months traveling with Meghan Nesbit who has worked for over a decade helping to empower communities and social change movements. We'll be journeying across the country documenting the reality of extreme extraction -- meeting people in their homes and on their land -- to truly convey the gravity of what we stand to lose. We will also chronicle the growing public movement fighting against dirty energy and their powerful backers. 

As we know, frightening statistics from scientific studies hasn't ignited enough action -- we need a deeper societal shift that can move the political mountains. It will take a kind of compassion for our fellow humans (and fellow creatures) that I believe can be spurred by personal stories.

Our journey is a project of the nonprofit news organization AlterNet where I have worked for the last six years as a senior editor and writer, heading up AlterNet’s coverage of environmental issues. We'll be documenting our experiences with updates from the road, including a travel blog, video profiles of the people we meet, photo essays, and in depth-feature stories. The end of the trip will culminate in a multi-media e-book that shows the human face of our energy decisions, the power structures that keep fossil fuels afloat, and the rising movement that is taking action and creating alternatives. 

This trip is simultaneously about diving deep into the personal, listening to people talk about their experiences, hopes, and fears. But it's also a big picture look at how our energy decisions are playing out right now and what will happen if we do not change course. 

I believe the stories from this project will have a broad reach. They will be published on AlterNet which has more than 2.5 million unique monthly visitors and we will be partnering with print, online, and broadcast partners to reach as many people as possible.

What We Need

We already have a generous donor to help with our vehicle, an amazing Cricket trailer, and support from AlterNet to pay my salary while I’m on the road. But we still need to raise money for trip expenses and production quality photography and video equipment, even though we’ll be doing this as cheaply as we can (hello, campgrounds!). We’re grateful for anyone who can contribute financially — big or small. Your donation is tax-deductible and will go entirely to trip expenses and publishing.

If you can’t give but want to support the project, please help spread the word in whatever way possible — share with family, friends, movers and shakers.
story_txt:
About the Project
During the last 15 years that I’ve been writing about the environment, I’ve watched an energy transition take place. First, I started out writing about mountaintop removal mining in Appalachia, then fracking in the Marcellus and across the West, then the Keystone XL pipeline, and now plans for oil and tar sands mining in Utah near some of my most beloved places on Earth. 
A war over energy is being fought in backyards across the country as millions of Americans are being impacted. The era of cheap and easy energy is over. Now, the price is higher and so are the stakes.
I've talked to people all across the country who have seen their neighborhoods turned into industrial zones because of extreme extraction and they are scared. It not only locks us into a future of catastrophic climate change, but is already endangering our health, our communities, our food, precious resources like water, and the safety of workers in virtually every state in the country.
If we are going to have any hope of breaking the political divide that stymies progress on environmental issues, we are going to have to understand the personal aspect of our energy decisions. I decided to launch Hitting Home to chronicle the growing number of moving personal stories that can shift the debate on energy. 
The Nitty Gritty
I plan to spend three months traveling with Meghan Nesbit who has worked for over a decade helping to empower communities and social change movements. We'll be journeying across the country documenting the reality of extreme extraction -- meeting people in their homes and on their land -- to truly convey the gravity of what we stand to lose. We will also chronicle the growing public movement fighting against dirty energy and their powerful backers. 
As we know, frightening statistics from scientific studies hasn't ignited enough action -- we need a deeper societal shift that can move the political mountains. It will take a kind of compassion for our fellow humans (and fellow creatures) that I believe can be spurred by personal stories.
Our journey is a project of the nonprofit news organization AlterNet where I have worked for the last six years as a senior editor and writer, heading up AlterNet’s coverage of environmental issues. This trip is simultaneously about diving deep into the personal, listening to people talk about their experiences, hopes, and fears. But it's also a big picture look at how our energy decisions are playing out right now and what will happen if we do not change course.

What We Need

But we still need to raise money for trip expenses and production quality photography and video equipment, even though we’ll be doing this as cheaply as we can (hello, campgrounds!). We’re grateful for anyone who can contribute financially — big or small. Your donation is tax-deductible and will go entirely to trip expenses and publishing.
If you can’t give but want to support the project, please help spread the word in whatever way possible — share with family, friends, movers and shakers.

story:
Landfills are becoming full, oceans are being polluted and our atmosphere is dangerously full of toxic gases that people are breathing in everyday. Yet our waste is growing faster than ever, and will grow tenfold by next year. Most of the rubbish in a landfill doesn't decompose because it gets trapped of oxygen, being preserved under mountains of other rubbish. Because of this, large amounts of methane, a greenhouse gas 30 times stronger than carbon dioxide, is created and is contaminating air, soil and local groundwater. 

By diverting the waste by recycling, we reduce how much is in landfill, but waste time, money and resources in the process. If we continue to divert, we will continue to create. Single use plastics will still be made, and our natural resources will continue to deplete. 

Instead of diverting waste, we need to REDUCE waste. 

Instead of your pasta being sold in a plastic bag, you'll bring your own bag, and put the pasta in yourself. You choose the bag, you choose how much pasta. Or rice. Or popcorn. Or nuts, spices, soap...(you get it.) Reducing how much plastic is made, will reduce our waste. 

Simply, bring in a tupperware box, jar or bag, weigh it in store, fill it up with food, and pay.

Items in The Store will be free of non-recycled plastic, and sourced and manufactured as locally as possible. Not only, will we sell food, but also many other items that will help us reduce our day-to-day waste. 

I'm Rosanna; born and raised in Milton Keynes, I moved to Bedford in 2010 and have since got married here and made it my home. 

I've always been concerned about caring for the environment, but believed there was not much I could ever really do to make a difference. Combining my sense for business, my concern for the environment and my investment into developing Bedford's local economy, I've spent the past 18 months researching, talking and planning this business.

Alongside my own knowledge, I've received professional business advice, support and mentoring most of the way to help make sure this business is successful. 

In addition to my own personal financial investment, I am applying for a business loan through the Princes Trust. However, I still need additional financial support to help bring this shop to Bedford. 

On top of administration, licensing and start up costs, the three major areas that need covering are

  • Product and stock 
  • Equipment, fixtures and fittings 
  • Securing the premises in Bedford (and this is where I need your help) 

Bringing this shop to Bedford, to some has sounded crazy. But to many of us, it's home, and it deserves investment. That's why I have chosen to bring this business to our small quaint town, where I believe it will thrive. 

I need £7000 to help me secure and fit out the shop premises, to become a wonderful new space to our town. 

                         

In addition to supporter rewards, all supporters will be personally recognised and thanked for their contribution to this project. Without you, this wouldn't be possible.

You will also be the first to hear on updates, and invited to give input into shop development through opportunities for feedback. 

I understand that not everyone will be able to give, but I'd still love your support.

  • Share my campaign on social media 
  • Shop local, invest in your town 
  • Come and visit us when we open!

Thank you for reading, sharing, giving and supporting.

story:
(scroll down to see how you can get a free trip to tour intentional communities!)

Dear contributors,

My name is Chloe and I am a member of Direct Action Valhalla (DAV).

I want to take a moment and express my gratitude for your support. 

It is SO important that we take the necessary steps as brothers and sisters to keep our planet pristine and in a manner that encourages happiness and prosperity.  

We have a pressing urgency ahead of us, but let us not get discouraged because we have the ability to do something today!

This summer DAV wants to give the opportunity to help our fellow humans and spread the necessary knowledge to do so on a personal level.

How?

Our crew is going to spread permaculture concepts across North America USING A 100% FOSSIL FREE RV!!! 

Why is this so crucial? 

Permanent agriculture or food forests encourages:

 -people to support natural, local practices instead of harsh chemicals and abused labor

-children to go outdoors and experience nature instead of processed foods and obesity 

-a happy community of people instead of isolated neighborhoods

-more free time instead of longer hours of work for food costs

For every person that we can share this knowledge with they can share it with ten more!

This campaign is about strengthening connections to our fellow species and to our beautiful Earth. 

Thank you for being a proud supporter of Direct Action Valhalla,

Chloe

What We Need 

Traveling across North America in an off grid RV has a lot of initial expense and long term benefits.

(Route coming soon)  

Help us purchase and green our RV

  • RV costs

    -Camper itself: $2500

    -Renewable energy- $1,800

    -Compost toilet:$200

    -Stove and heat system:$2,200

    -Water catchment system- $50

    -Greenhouse-$900

  • Transportation

     -gas-$350 (veggie oil is free!)

     -filters- $300

     -upkeep: $2,500

  • Food costs on the road: $1,000

PERKS!!!

When you help us we help you too!!!

For donating anything including your time (aka reading and sharing) you are immediately apart of the support team of DAV!

  • Skype calls with the crew
  • personalized signature painted on our Rv
  • Ravenectar shirts (Super sick!!!)
  • ads on our RV
  • Permaculture guides
  • an intentional community tour!!
  • and more!

Other Ways You Can Help

"Intentional Communities" have been deemed with a bad rap from the 1960s as "hippie communes" but have actually been around since the beginning of human civilization! 

Definition:Intentional communities (IC) are a place where people come together to live based on the same values, same ideology, and preferred way of living.  

People may all live in the same house or the may all live in seperate housing structures with a common eating place.  The spectrum is vast and has a wide range of differences in each community.  

The commonalities each IC do share are these:

  • an emphasis on connections between people 
  • freedom to live in a preferred way without societal pressures
  • ability to have more time for activities based on personal preference

Get a free trip to tour intentional communities!!! 

Where will we go?  

ICs along the East Coast from Florida up to Montreal (QC)!

What you need to do: 

  1. Share this with 500 people
  2. Have each of them donate $2 (minimum)
  3. Make sure they send an email to davalhalla@gmail.com with your name!

The point is to raise $1,000 while getting the word out to as many people you can!


What will we do with the money if we don't raise enough?

We plan to travel

story:
SERCASIA is taking a further step in its campaign against the spread of plastic pollution in Lao PDR.

Following on the success of our short video "From Banana Leaves to Plastic Bags" (see on YouTube) we intend to continue our campaign to reach young people by making three short movies and broadcasting them in locations where young people gather: including schools and entertainment places all over the country. 

Our campaign calls for shooting 2-3 short films (under 1 minute)  with young people as the target audience as we feel they are the generation who can make changes and improve the situation.
 
The money raised will be used to make the films and then distribute then for viewing around the country: giving incentive to educators to show to the youth. If we raise enough money, we will continue our campaign to launch a Day Without Plastic in Lao PDR.
 
Please help. Rapid development in Laos is bringing consumption pollution at a wild pace while education about environmental pollution is limited here. These films and this campaign will be a starting point to raise awareness and stem the rising tide of plastic pollution.

 

Following on the success of SERCASIA’s first campaign video “From Banana Leaves to Plastic Bags,” (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UWrxkdh3p7k), SERCASIA is taking another bold step towards reducing the dissemination/proliferation of plastic bags in Vientiane.

Our first documentary film, produced in 2011 and shown at the Vientianale Film Festival, targeted an adult audience with messages on the environmental and health reasons for reducing plastic bag use and recycling plastic materials.

The second video we are producing, tentatively titled “Lao Youth Battle Plastic Waste Invasion,” will target a younger audience, from ages 6 to 16.

The dissemination of plastic bags (PB) in Vientiane continues unabated. In 2008, SERCASIA began to study the PB invasion in Vientiane and now sees the problem has spread all over the country. In short, too many people, Lao citizens and foreigners, are not conscious or not informed about the extent of the problem. In a previous paper we have estimated that 144 million PB were used per year in Vientiane Province alone. The problem is increasing rapidly to the rest of the country along with commercial and industrial  development. Plastic waste is growing at the same rate as the cash economy. 

Our short film is intended to help persuade young audiences to restrain using PB, and other plastic products such as plastic cups, Styrofoam containers, etc. This video would like to show and reward the good behaviour of people who REFUSE to use PB and other plastics… Plastic’s not cool!!

SERCASIA is planning to shoot the video, place it on YouTube, and distribute it in schools, colleges, the Lao youth movement, and commercial places where young people gather.

The projected budget for production and distribution is US$5.000. To raise this amount, we are seeking socially concerned donors who can contribute partial funding. 

The number of sponsors behind the project is as important as the total sum collected. The main objective is to show the campaign is being supported by many donors/ funders. Their support for the effort to reduce the amount of plastic waste in the capital city of Lao PDR will be seen and appreciated by many.

The creative content of the video may consist of one or more vignettes and these may be acted in mime for visual, attention-grabbing effect and for universal understanding.

Among the “story-board” concepts being considered for the video are:

  • Two adult clowns are “playing” with PB and tossing other plastic around and inadvertently recover a child clown
  • A man or woman who buys food and other items comes back with goods wrapped in PB… and the PB keeps piling up on a table,  while his/her twin goes to market with a recycled bag and does not have to deal  with piles of PB
  • Supplies of food are delivered to a restaurant where food in PB, until the entire kitchen is covered in and littered with PB. The waiters end  up selling plastic bags instead of food
  • A toddler is given a plastic bag to play with, and we see the toddler growing and the same PB following the growing character. The PB does not disappear even when the character is 100 years old
  • Other concepts are being considered

If there is spoken language or narrative used in the video it will be in Lao.

 

A Lao audience, and especially young people, must be able to relate to the language and characters.

I am available to provide further information about our work and how we could work together.

Serge Doussantousse

My email is sergefabali@gmail.com, 020 224 18 398
