story:
For $25 U.S, It is quite simply NOT POSSIBLE to go wrong                       (to avoid distortion, please open your screen as wide as possible)            Cyril Bay Trinidad - my childhood home / our Sunday destination and                 Grand Illusion - our 76 ft Magic Carpet Catamaran                        A HANDFUL OF RATIONAL, LITERATE INDIVIDUALS ARE REQUIRED                      WE REALLY NEED your EARLY contribution to                                                                                                   ThePerfectEscape n.b. >                       and (as you can see) WE KNOW IT                                                 in this case, "n.b." can also stand for "NO BRAINER"                                                 $10,000 U.S. can buy a lot of T shirts.                                                                           $25 U.S. - not so much                                                                 The name says it all                                      not too decadent - not too extreme                             perfectly simple and simply perfect                               authentic, natural & spontaneous                                                        just perfect

This campaign is intended to provide the funds, which are required for the first step in the start up of of our Trinidad operation,  AND a huge market  for our product by means of providing a large diverse network of knowledgeable,  highly motivated contributors / members / agents. 


It is virtually certain that EARLY contributors will (with a minimum of effort)  at the very least, find themselves in a position  to enjoy (with a companion) an annual 1 week  UNIQUE, exhilarating, mind changing, all inclusive vacation with The Perfect Escape - FOR FREE.


Highly rational, LITERATE individuals are required to fill this role as they need to be capable of  CLEARLY understanding -   WHY (in light of the multitude of inherent substantial advantages this operation will enjoy) the totally outrageous numbers above and below are, in fact, rational, reasonable and fairly accurate. THIS PARAGRAPH IS THE KEY TO THE SUCCESS OF THIS CAMPAIGN AND THIS PROJECT


Not being  capable of understanding the above is a direct result of a desperate, unshakeable, clinging to wilful, lazy, collective INSANE STUPIDITY which, unfortunately, according to Einstein (and I have been sadly forced to endorse) is apparently extremely common. 


Clearly, individuals of the former description are few and far between - and difficult to find - on planet earth . No doubt, Mars might provide better pickings. However, that option may be a bit problematic at the moment. 

All I can do then is continues to hope for a few individuals to turn up - who are willing to battle the tide of collective insane stupidity - which threatens to sweep everyone along with it - and focus on finding THE TRUTH  - wherever it happens to be hidden. 

                           click here for technical info. 

                          projected R.O.A. 198% 

                             Apple R.O.A. 17.8%

      It could be that the totally outrageous numbers above                              may merit a little further investigation                                                          perhaps, starting here                                                    A few functioning brain cells and a little focus may be required  -                                 along with a basic grasp of readin, ritin & rithmetic.                                                                Rocket science is not a requisite.

            

      Hopefully, I FINALLY understand it well enough. However -       the more brain cells and attention YOU can bring the better -                    and the more rewards you are likely to take away 

                               original campaign page 

                            robby@the perfectescape.net

                north coast - Trinidad - our "playground"   

                                   we can hang out here  

                          or maybe do a little peaceful fishing                                                                 here          here        here 


         FISHING FOR FOOD AND FOR FUN


We make no claims to be a "SPORT - FISHING" operation and we will be trying to avoid that label - and all its connotations. We will be spending a lot of time FISHING for FOOD - and having a lot of FUN doing it - as our species has been doing for millenniums, However, torturing fish in the name of "SPORT" is not "our thing". 

If we are fortunate enough to catch more than we need, we will be selling the surplus to help cover expenses. That being said (for novice and expert alike) we will be providing a UNIQUE fishing experience of incredible variety, and non stop action - unlike anything they have ever experienced. With us, you will never here those often used words "That's why they call it FISHING - and not CATCHING",  

There will be a few peaceful occasions on our fishing trips (from time to time) and, of course, unlimited supplies of the finest freshest seafood you will ever eat. To go along with the latter, there will be a wide selection of exciting Caribbean dishes and  exotic tropical fruit.


In regard to "peace and serenity", there will be plenty to be had - during the evenings at our wonderful rustic Island home - and during our alternative non fishing days - when you may peacefully laze about "down d islands" (accompanied, you can be sure, by a few "Trinis")  to you heart's content.

The latter assumes you can resist the allure of our 24 ft. "Mini Illusions" - which will be ready to take you off on your own personal "Magic Carpet Ride" of exploration, discovery and adventure "down d islands". Mind you, they can also be used to transport you to your own private oasis of "peace and serenity".

These "Mini Illusions" will also be towed out with us to our offshore fishing area - to serve as fishing tenders - thereby, enabling the pursuit and capture of very large fish - WITHOUT creating total chaos with all the other fishing systems - operating simultaneously from Grand Illusion. 

In addition to providing another UNIQUE exciting activity for our guests,  LARGE mature individual fish (such as tuna, swordfish and grouper) make for some of the finest eating. All in all, after a week with us, experiencing the entire spectrum  - from action and adventure to peace and serenity, it will likely be a difficult task - dragging yourself back to boring, stressful reality. 

                            

                        IMMEDIATE GOAL

I am out of time in MY NOVICE EFFORT to secure funding for the completion of my project to relocate our 76 ft. sail assisted, power catamaran Grand Illusion to Trinidad and start up my planned operation there - and I am starting this new campaign - limited to funding the first step in that project - namely, preparations for and the staging of sea trials- here in Margarita, Venezuela - with our current team. 

90% of the components for the  sailing rig and the high speed trolling systems (required for these runs)  are already on hand and just need installation. Getting Grand Illusion back in top shape and installing the (dry assembled) top deck completes the list of preparations required.

Sea trials will provide  concrete, irrefutable evidence that my planned Trinidad operation will be extraordinarily successful. This evidence will consist of videos, written records and first hand experience - regarding the performance of Grand Illusion in brisk, open ocean ocean, trade wind conditions - and the productivity of our high speed trolling systems.

The latter will provide very accurate projections for the purely commercial  high speed trolling operation which will be the first aspect of our Trinidad operation and will continue to provide substantial  revenues - as other aspects of the operation come on line. In the meantime, despite radically lower fish prices in Venezuela,  sea trials will  provide significant revenues, through fish sales here in Margarita.

MOST IMPORTANTLY however, the results of these sea trials will provide us with the CREDIBILITY and  VISIBILITY to, FIRST and FOREMOST, put together THE best possible Trinidad Team to - 1. help with raising AMPLE capital  - to ensure a smooth, rapid successful  relocation to Trinidad - and 2. to set up and run the planned Trinidad operation (under my direction) with an extremely high level of efficiency,  effectiveness, productivity and profitability.

Obviously, our "perks" are of no use UNTIL Grand Illusion is FULLY operational in Trinidad. However from successful trial runs in Margarita to successful BASIC operations in Trinidad is just a matter of a 120 mile day trip. From BASIC operation to FULL operation in Trinidad is just a matter of making suitable arrangements for the use of THE RIGHT "down d islands" House - and setting up our offshore Fish. Aggregating. Device. system.  

         MORE ABOUT OUR AMAZING PERKS

In an overabundance of caution the start date for the delivery of our perks has been  set at June 2017. However, we have every reason to believe that our actual start up of full operations in Trinidad and our ability to deliver on our perks will be way before that date.

Except for the  current featured perk  (a "NO BRAINER" MEMBERSHIP) we only provide 1 type of perk- namely, a membership in The Perfect Escape. The only things that change, as time goes on, are - the name - the number available - and the size of the contribution required to claim this perk. Please be sure to claim your perk(s) -  if and when you choose to contribute.

Let us assume you were an early $25 U.S. Contributor and  claimed 1 "NO BRAINER" MEMBERSHIP. Further assuming that you  claimed 4 "BONUS" MEMBERSHIPS, would leave you with a total of 5 memberships. This would entitle you to 10 places on any Perfect Escape tour - on a reserved basis - or on a standby basis - or any combination of the two.

Let us stipulate a 1 week, all inclusive, tour price of $1,500 U.S. per person (as par for the course) and an average NET commission to you of 15 % - or $225 U.S. per person. Assuming you were able to sell (per annum - to friends and acquaintances)  anywhere from 1 place on 30 tours to 10 places on 3 tours, this  would result in 30 sales - for a total of $6,750 U.S. - in commissions. 

Naturally, the number of trips per annum, one chooses to participate in, would have no effect on the above numbers. As such, if one chooses to no longer have any contact with The Perfect Escape, one would have a fairly valuable asset to sell -  namely, 1 "NO BRAINER" MEMBERSHIP (which cost $25 U.S.)  along with 4 "BONUS" MEMBERSHIPS  - which were  FREE.

As to what someone might be willing to pay for a small, zero overhead,  zero operating costs "business" which generated net annual revenues of $6,750 U.S.  - plus providing personal holiday discounts - who can say? However, (using a conservative price / earnings multiple of 10 ) - would put a value right at  $67,500 U.S.  - not bad for a $25 U.S. "contribution"

So - let us say we have been 10 times too optimistic - and instead of making   30 sales a year we only make 3 sales a year. As a result, instead of making $67,500 U.S. in capital gains on our $25 U.S. contribution (after a couple of years of operation) we only make $6,750 U.S. It seems that it would be  insanely stupid - to expect this news to send most of our early contributors running to the nearest windows and leaping to their deaths.

Which is why they are named "NO BRAINER"  MEMBERSHIPS. If every thing goes well, some version of the the above range of scenarios will apply to you. If everything goes horribly wrong you lose $25 U,S. (not your home or your business or your farm or your first born child or a pound of flesh) $25 U.S. 

The classic definition of  "NO BRAINER" is that a decision  is so obviously the right one - that it does not require the use of one's brain - hence the name. Some might claim that my rather advanced age and consequent propensity for dropping dead of a heart attack might constitute a valid rational reason for NOT assuming the enormous, scary, stressful risk of a $25 U.S. contribution 

However, considering the relatively short time frame between assuming  this risk and our operation being totally viable - under ANY reasonably capable management, one may as well assert that the risk of a younger founder being killed by a cement truck was a valid reason for not investing in his project.  

NOTWITHSTANDING all of the above, there is NO QUESTION that if 40 individuals should claim these perks - and make NO further efforts  whatsoever towards securing further contributors (in the short term) and guests (in the longer term)  NO ONE will likely ever see a single reward for their contribution or investment.


                                      TRINIDAD OPERATION

The FULL Trinidad operation is described at length and in detail on the web page THE PERFECT ESCAPE - PART 2.  A brief synopsis follows (in the form of a letter to and old friend and owner/operator of a large luxury yacht) which may provide you with an insight into The Perfect Escape  - from a deeper perspective.

                                                 

                                             LOOSE ENDS

Hi Mark, 

This message is just to tidy up some loose ends. Perhaps, the most important aspect of your perception of my plan (not surprisingly - seeing as you have obviously spent very little time investigating the information I have  provided )  is your overall picture of The Perfect Escape - which I plan to provide our guests

Let me stress that everything, in this message, has already been covered on many of my web pages. I would also like to point out that I do not think you will find any guest more “picky” and harder to please than ME - in regard to marine tours of any kind.

I have spent my entire life (from an early age) in a wide variety of ”Tropical Paradises” – and I am obviously spoiled rotten - in this regard. Consequently, you would have to PAY ME – somewhere in the vicinity of, the price of any tour - to get me to go on it. I guess this would also apply to a tour on your yacht – although, I might give you a 50% discount on my price – seeing as you are a good friend. Don’t get me wrong - I am quite sure I would be very comfortable. 

However, my main problem is a very low threshold of boredom. I think that  more adventurous (purpose driven) activities will be required - than you are equipped for - or accustomed to providing - in order to keep me from being bored out of my skull. At the other end of the spectrum, I would likely demand a payment of 3 times the price to join an extreme adventure tour of any kind. As to cruise ships - in my opinion, they combine the worst of all possible worlds.

So what sort of a tour WOULD provide The Perfect Escape for me and hopefully a very wide range of others - including my children-and their children – AND, I would like to think, you and Sue and Tashi.  One thing for sure, it would not involve "floating around in the middle of the ocean - mindlessly fishing for a straight week".

Where on earth do you get these ideas from – you must think I am crazy. Oh  - I forgot - you do - along with many others. First of all, you need to take into account where we are at this time geographically and otherwise  My plan (since I have been here on Isla Margarita, Venezuela) was to operate 1 week "glam camping" tours on Isla Blanquilla – about 50 miles north of Margarita. However, that dream has gone down the drain– along with the dreams of most Venezuelans.

Trinidad (120 miles away) has no Isla Blanquilla, but I am a Trinidad citizen and it does have “down d islands” -15 minute from the excellent marine and general facilities on the mainland - at Chaguaramas , As such, a large island house (augmented by glam- camping facilities) will make a wonderful rustic but very comfortable “base camp” for our 1 week tours – built  around 3 very comfortable exciting and productive open ocean fishing day trips - for the whole family.

These trips would be similar to our trips to the Autec buoy off Nassau in The Bahamas on Little Trick. However, obviously with our 76 ft. Grand Illusion there will be - much more comfort - variety - excitement - exhilaration - and production. These trips will specifically NOT be focused on emulating your typical SPORT- FISHING trip - but rather on providing a modern version of artisanal / recreational hook and line fishing - which has been providing family groups with food and fun for millenniums.

It should also be kept in mind that half the time on these trips will be spent in fast, exhilarating  motor sailing (specifically designed to emulate a pure sailing experience) to and from our extensive F.A.D. fishing system - with the added excitement and exhilaration provided by our UNIQUE, innovative, commercial, high speed trolling system which will thrill ALL our guests and which the more adventurous  may choose to participate in. 

While "FOOD & FUN FISHING" will be the ostensible purpose for these trips. Our extensive, innovative,  open ocean  F.A.D. (Fish Aggregating Device) system will provide a "WONDER - FULL", UNIQUE, rich, exhilarating - yet peaceful environment which (with our huge variety of gear ) our guests will be able to take FULL advantage of - in a myriad of ways.

On Sundays we plan an inshore trip to Cyril bay - a wonderful hidden paradise nestled in the rain forest on the rugged north coast of Trinidad - where I happen to have spent a few great childhood years. The other 2 days of our tour will be spent just “messing about - down d islands” – as Trinidad families have been doing for many generations. 

While there is a variety of night life available, a short boat ride away, at Chaguaramas, I would expect that, (after a super exhilarating day at sea on Grand Illusion or "simply messing about - down d islands") on most evenings, our guests will opt for simple activities - at our charming rustic island home. Mind you, a few of the younger fishing fanatics may be into a little night fishing from Grand Illusion - anchored a hundred yards or so away.

All in all we will be providing a UNIQUE, innovative, exciting version of an “AUTHENTIC Trinidad experience”– and a far cry, it would seem, from the very negative image you have been carrying around in your head. For god's sake Mark - don't  be an "old fuddy duddy" - thinking that the generations of today want exactly the same boring contrived product which luxury charter yachts have been serving up for them - for the last century.

There is an AUTHENTIC Goldilocks zone (between the CONTRIVED decadence offered by luxury yacht and cruise ships on the one hand and the equally CONTRIVED extreme adventure tours on the other hand) which I have been very familiar with all my life and find very pleasing - as does virtually everyone - WHEN AND IF, they  are fortunate to experience it, We intend that The Perfect Escape will fit right into that Goldilocks zone and consequently keep our guests and their friends coming back for more. 


                  TESTIMONIAL
Robby,
 I am in the process of garnering statements from Gardner Young about LITTLE TRICK, he was taken to Georgetown 160 miles South of Nassau for the Regatta on board Little Trick. 
Being an Off Shore Power Boat Racer he was bemused by the tiny outboard motor - but very quickly, crossing the banks in the teeth of a 20 knot SE wind, he soon realized that this was a boat from another dimension. First of all it was incredibly stable and dry which is to say that he had no problem mixing and drinking the cocktails that celebrated this magic carpet. 
Averaging 20 knots with a single 100 h.p. outboard, they made the passage to Georgetown in 8 hours of stable running, most likely consuming more gin then gas!. Gardner, who was critical of the design and low horsepower was won over.
The design remains unique. However, like so many brilliant and forward thinking designs in every discipline it will languish away until sometime in the not too distant future will 'discover' it and with the proper financing and publicity make a fortune.

You are a Marine Visionary Robby and I just wish to hell those who reject your ideas could see this and profit, financially and spiritually, from them.

All the best, Krov
The Rt. Hon Krov Menuhin

Risks

No doubt, there are many risks we may have to deal with, in relocating our "non-operation". However, THE ONLY MAJOR RISK is whether or not we can FIND SUFFICIENT RATIONAL people - or CONVERT SUFFICIENT people to RATIONALITY (or any combination of the above) to provide SUFFICIENT funding to deal with these other risks. 

From my perspective, it seems unlikely. However, there HAS to be  a BUNCH of rational people hiding somewhere - to create all this amazing "stuff". I suspect many may be hiding in Silicon Valley, However, I have no clue how to contact them.  Perhaps you have an idea or two. 

I hope to soon "welcome you aboard" - figuratively - and later literally - and that, unlike most, you UNDERSTAND the difference between the two. If you should choose to make a contribution. I hope you  also UNDERSTAND that the future value of your $25 U.S contribution and my $250,000 U.S. investment are both entirely dependant on our success - in helping a few others to UNDERSTAND our project. 


Robby N

Highly rational, LITERATE individuals are required to fill this role as they need to be capable of  CLEARLY understanding -   WHY (in light of the multitude of inherent substantial advantages this operation will enjoy) the totally outrageous numbers above and below are, in fact, rational, reasonable and fairly accurate. THIS PARAGRAPH IS THE KEY TO THE SUCCESS OF THIS CAMPAIGN AND THIS PROJECT

Not being  capable of understanding the above is a direct result of a desperate, unshakeable, clinging to wilful, lazy, collective INSANE STUPIDITY which, unfortunately, according to Einstein (and I have been sadly forced to endorse) is apparently extremely common. 



Clearly, individuals of the former description are few and far between - and difficult to find - on planet earth . No doubt, Mars might provide better pickings. However, that option may be a bit problematic at the moment. 
All I can do then is continues to hope for a few individuals to turn up - who are willing to battle the tide of collective insane stupidity - which threatens to sweep everyone along with it - and focus on finding THE TRUTH  - wherever it happens to be hidden.

The only things that change, as time goes on, are - the name - the number available - and the size of the contribution required to claim this perk. Please be sure to claim your perk(s) -  if and when you choose to contribute.



Let us assume you were an early $25 U.S. Contributor and  claimed 1 "NO BRAINER" MEMBERSHIP. Further assuming that you  claimed 4 "BONUS" MEMBERSHIPS, would leave you with a total of 5 memberships. This would entitle you to 10 places on any Perfect Escape tour - on a reserved basis - or on a standby basis - or any combination of the two.
Let us stipulate a 1 week, all inclusive, tour price of $1,500 U.S. per person (as par for the course) and an average NET commission to you of 15 % - or $225 U.S. per person. Assuming you were able to sell (per annum - to friends and acquaintances)  anywhere from 1 place on 30 tours to 10 places on 3 tours, this  would result in 30 sales - for a total of $6,750 U.S. - in commissions. 

Naturally, the number of trips per annum, one chooses to participate in, would have no effect on the above numbers. As such, if one chooses to no longer have any contact with The Perfect Escape, one would have a fairly valuable asset to sell -  namely, 1 "NO BRAINER" MEMBERSHIP (which cost $25 U.S.)  along with 4 "BONUS" MEMBERSHIPS  - which were  FREE.
As to what someone might be willing to pay for a small, zero overhead,  zero operating costs "business" which generated net annual revenues of $6,750 U.S.  - plus providing personal holiday discounts - who can say? However, (using a conservative price / earnings multiple of 10 ) - would put a value right at  $67,500 U.S.  - not bad for a $25 U.S. "contribution"
So - let us say we have been 10 times too optimistic - and instead of making   30 sales a year we only make 3 sales a year. As a result, instead of making $67,500 U.S. in capital gains on our $25 U.S. contribution (after a couple of years of operation) we only make $6,750 U.S. It seems that it would be  insanely stupid - to expect this news to send most of our early contributors running to the nearest windows and leaping to their deaths.

Which is why they are named "NO BRAINER"  MEMBERSHIPS. If every thing goes well, some version of the the above range of scenarios will apply to you. If everything goes horribly wrong you lose $25 U,S. (not your home or your business or your farm or your first born child or a pound of flesh) $25 U.S. 


The classic definition of  "NO BRAINER" is that a decision  is so obviously the right one - that it does not require the use of one's brain - hence the name. Some might claim that my rather advanced age and consequent propensity for dropping dead of a heart attack might constitute a valid rational reason for NOT assuming the enormous, scary, stressful risk of a $25 U.S. contribution 
However, considering the relatively short time frame between assuming  this risk and our operation being totally viable - under ANY reasonably capable management, one may as well assert that the risk of a younger founder being killed by a cement truck was a valid reason for not investing in his project.  
NOTWITHSTANDING all of the above, there is NO QUESTION that if 40 individuals should claim these perks - and make NO further efforts  whatsoever towards securing further contributors (in the short term) and guests (in the longer term)  NO ONE will likely ever see a single reward for their contribution or investment.


                                      TRINIDAD OPERATION

The FULL Trinidad operation is described at length and in detail on the web page THE PERFECT ESCAPE - PART 2.  A brief synopsis follows (in the form of a letter to and old friend and owner/operator of a large luxury yacht) which may provide you with an insight into The Perfect Escape  - from a deeper perspective.

                                                 
                                             LOOSE ENDS
Hi Mark, 
This message is just to tidy up some loose ends. Perhaps, the most
important aspect of your perception of my plan (not surprisingly - seeing as
you have obviously spent very little time investigating the information I have  provided )  is your overall picture of The Perfect Escape - which I plan to
provide our guests
Let me stress that everything, in this message, has already been covered on many of my web pages. I would also like to point out that I do not think you will find any guest more “picky” and harder to please
than ME - in regard to marine tours of any kind.
I have spent my entire life (from an early age) in a wide
variety of ”Tropical Paradises”
– and I am obviously spoiled rotten
- in this regard. Consequently, you would have to PAY ME – somewhere in
the vicinity of, the price of any tour - to get me
to go on it. I guess this would also apply to a tour on your yacht – although, I might give you a 50% discount on my price – seeing as you are a good friend. Don’t
get me wrong - I am quite sure I would be very comfortable. 
However, my main problem is a very low threshold of boredom. I think that  more adventurous (purpose driven) activities will be required - than you are equipped for - or accustomed to
providing - in order to keep me from being bored out of my skull. At the other end of the spectrum, I would likely demand a payment of
3 times the price to join
an extreme adventure tour of any
kind. As to cruise ships - in my
opinion, they combine the worst of all possible worlds.
So what sort of a tour WOULD provide The Perfect
Escape for me and hopefully a very wide range of others - including my children-and
their children – AND, I would like to think, you and Sue and Tashi.  One thing for sure, it would not involve "floating around in the middle of the ocean - mindlessly fishing for a straight week". 
Where on earth do you get these ideas from – you must
think I am crazy. Oh  - I
forgot - you do - along with many others. First of all, you
need to take into account where we are
at this time geographically and otherwise  My plan (since I have been here on Isla Margarita, Venezuela) was to operate 1 week "glam
camping" tours on Isla Blanquilla – about 50
miles north of Margarita. However, that dream has gone down the drain– along with the
dreams of most Venezuelans.
Trinidad (120 miles away) has
no Isla Blanquilla, but I am a Trinidad citizen and it does
have “down d islands” -15 minute from
the excellent marine and general
facilities on the mainland - at Chaguaramas , As such, a large island house (augmented by glam- camping facilities) will make a wonderful rustic but very comfortable “base camp” for
our 1 week tours – built  around 3 very comfortable
exciting and productive open ocean fishing day trips - for the whole family.
These trips would be similar to our trips to the Autec buoy off Nassau in The Bahamas on Little Trick. However, obviously with our 76 ft. Grand Illusion there will be - much more comfort - variety
- excitement - exhilaration - and production. These trips will specifically NOT
be focused on emulating your typical SPORT- FISHING trip - but rather on providing a modern version of artisanal / recreational hook and line
fishing - which has been providing family
groups with food and fun for millenniums.
It should also be kept in mind that half the time on these trips will be spent in fast, exhilarating  motor sailing (specifically designed to emulate a pure sailing experience) to and from our extensive F.A.D. fishing system - with the added excitement and exhilaration provided by our UNIQUE, innovative, commercial, high speed trolling system which will thrill ALL our guests and which the more adventurous  may choose to participate in. 
While "FOOD & FUN FISHING" will be the ostensible purpose for these trips. Our extensive, innovative,  open ocean  F.A.D. (Fish Aggregating Device) system will provide a "WONDER - FULL", UNIQUE, rich, exhilarating - yet peaceful environment which (with our huge variety of gear ) our guests will be able to take FULL advantage of - in a myriad of ways.
On
Sundays we plan an
inshore trip to Cyril bay - a
wonderful hidden paradise nestled in
the rain forest on the rugged north coast of Trinidad - where I happen to have
spent a few great childhood years. The other 2 days of our tour will be spent just “messing about - down d islands” – as Trinidad families have been doing for many
generations. 
While there is a variety of night life available, a short boat
ride away, at Chaguaramas, I would expect that, (after a super exhilarating day at sea on Grand Illusion or "simply messing about - down d islands") on most evenings, our guests will opt for
simple activities - at our charming rustic island home. Mind you, a few of the younger
fishing fanatics may be into a little night fishing from Grand Illusion - anchored a hundred yards or so away.

All in all we will be providing a UNIQUE, innovative, exciting version of
an “AUTHENTIC Trinidad experience”– and a far cry, it would seem, from the very negative image you have been carrying around in your head. For god's sake Mark - don't  be an "old fuddy duddy" - thinking that the generations of today want exactly the same boring contrived product which luxury charter yachts have been serving up for them - for the last century.
There is an AUTHENTIC Goldilocks zone (between the CONTRIVED decadence offered by luxury yacht and cruise ships on the one hand and the equally CONTRIVED extreme adventure tours on the other hand) which I have been very familiar with all my life and find very pleasing - as does virtually everyone - WHEN AND IF, they  are fortunate to experience it, We intend that The Perfect Escape will fit right into that Goldilocks zone and consequently keep our guests and their friends coming back for more. 




                  TESTIMONIAL


Robby,
 I am in the process of garnering statements from Gardner Young about LITTLE TRICK, he was taken to Georgetown 160 miles South of Nassau for the Regatta on board Little Trick. 
Being an Off Shore Power Boat Racer he was bemused by the tiny outboard motor - but very quickly, crossing the banks in the teeth of a 20 knot SE wind, he soon realized that this was a boat from another dimension. First of all it was incredibly stable and dry which is to say that he had no problem mixing and drinking the cocktails that celebrated this magic carpet. 

Averaging 20 knots with a single 100 h.p. outboard, they made the passage to Georgetown in 8 hours of stable running, most likely consuming more gin then gas!. Gardner, who was critical of the design and low horsepower was won over.
The design remains unique. However, like so many brilliant and forward thinking designs in every discipline it will languish away until sometime in the not too distant future will 'discover' it and with the proper financing and publicity make a fortune.You are a Marine Visionary Robby and I just wish to hell those who reject your ideas could see this and profit, financially and spiritually, from them.All the best, KrovThe Rt. Hon Krov Menuhineco - credentials - Spirit of The Bahamas                                                      
                                                      ORIGINAL CAMPAIGN
FINANCIAL INFO
IMAGES

VIDEOS:
 "down d islands" - base camp
north coast - playground
Chaguaramas - home port
high speed wahoo trolling
"Greenstick" tuna trolling
"dangle fishing"
The Perfect Escape - part 1
The Perfect Escape - part 2
old web sites



Risks
No doubt, there are many risks we may have to deal with, in relocating our "non-operation". However, THE ONLY MAJOR RISK is whether or not we can FIND SUFFICIENT RATIONAL people - or CONVERT SUFFICIENT people to RATIONALITY (or any combination of the above) to provide SUFFICIENT funding to deal with these other risks. 
From my perspective, it seems unlikely. However, there HAS to be  a BUNCH of rational people hiding somewhere - to create all this amazing "stuff". I suspect many may be hiding in Silicon Valley, However, I have no clue how to contact them.  Perhaps you have an idea or two. 
I hope to soon "welcome you aboard" - figuratively - and later literally - and that, unlike most, you UNDERSTAND the difference between the two. If you should choose to make a contribution. I hope you  also UNDERSTAND that the future value of your $25 U.S contribution and my $250,000 U.S. investment are both entirely dependant on our success - in helping a few others to UNDERSTAND our project. 

Robby N
campaign_city: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago

story:
Help Elizabeth Anna Self-Publish Her Long-Awaited Gardening Book!


The Unconventional Edible Garden:
Growing Food in Texas and Other Hard and Difficult Places


The Unconventional Edible Garden is an 8x10", softcover, 140-page month-by-month growing guide with concise monthly to-do lists, planting instructions, permaculture musings, and personal memoirs. There are no other books on the market for our climate like this and it will be a treasure for so many gardeners!


Click on "Gallery" for a peek inside the book!


Elizabeth Samudio, Certified Permaculture Designer and owner of Elizabeth Anna Urban Farm & Market, has spent many years compiling the best of her expert gardening advice into a month-by-month guide, tailored for North Texas. 

Elizabeth, a transplant, brought her commitment of green living to North Texas over ten years ago when she filled an earthen container with herbs, blooms, and edibles in front of Starbucks. It's no surprise, since her roots go deep into the fertile culture of the Pacific Northwest.

Her love for nature and beauty has grown into an all-organic, eco-friendly farm, garden, and landscape business, as well as a grocery and produce shop. She teaches classes at the farm, but until now, her wisdom of applying permaculture principles to our specific climate has been difficult to sum up.

Elizabeth had written most of her book many years ago, but had let it sit untouched for a while. Then last year, while unable to work outdoors due to ovarian cancer, she found herself with plenty of time to put the finishing touches on her masterpiece.

So we are thrilled to announce that the book you have been hearing about and waiting for these past several years is finally ready for the public! We will use the results of this fundraiser to help make the final printing decisions.

Book credits:
Cover photos and full-page photos by Rachel Marek
All other photos by James and Elizabeth Samudio
Copy editing and graphic design by Tina Arons and Kimberly Briley

What We Need

We will be honest: we do not have the capital necessary to order a whole run of books. With $1,500 to $2,500, we can order at least 100 books, but the printing quality may suffer at the lower end of the budget. Any less than $1,500 and we will have to order a smaller run of books at a more expensive per-unit cost.

Frankly, we are hoping to order more than 100, maybe many more, which of course, would require more funds.

We are currently shopping around for the best price and quality, but we know this is the general range needed.

Our goal is to have the books printed and shipped by the end of September, just in time for cooler gardening weather!

What You Get

Rewards for this campaign include The Unconventional Edible Garden in print, a digital ebook, and various in-person permaculture classes at the shop with Elizabeth or her helpers, depending on her health at the time. Also available is a personal consultation at your property, where Elizabeth's husband will outline the potentials of your land.

Risks & Challenges

We have had a lot of interest in this book already, but honestly, we are not sure the realistic demand there will be for copies! This fundraiser will help us get a clearer picture of how many books we should be ordering, so we don't under-order and have to buy more later at a higher rate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page so we can raise enough funds to order the book in time for fall!

In the off-chance that you have connections with a book printing company and can cut us a deal, well, that would be helpful. :)

Help Elizabeth achieve her dream of seeing this book published, and help countless home gardeners learn confidence in themselves through a better understanding of nature!

story:
Introduction

The proposed research activities will generate three distinct data sets, which will be disseminated by publishing a series of three journal articles in relevant academic journals and will also be presented at relevant academic and water management conferences. This study will use interview and archival methods and discourse analysis to accomplish three research objectives: (1) to investigate the actions of the actors and institutions behind the failure to resolve the longest water conflict in U.S. history; (2) to investigate the extent to which metropolitan Atlanta’s growth machine of urban and suburban development is contingent upon the production and distribution of massive quantities of freshwater from the ACF Basin; and (3) to explore how the dominant discursive production of the “water crisis,” emphasizing the natural-ness of water scarcity, has allowed powerful economic and political interests to further capital-intensive economic development in Atlanta and state-building in Georgia. In this context, the study will examine the extent to which these interests have pressured the principal federal water management agency, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), to adopt neoliberal governance practices that favor greater water concessions for metropolitan Atlanta, at the expense of the States of Florida and Alabama.

This inquiry will be conducted using a variety of qualitative research methods. Structured and semi-structured interviews with water regulators, state and federal policymakers, and major industrial representatives will determine the trends in freshwater consumption among the various stakeholders to the ACF water conflict, including the sources and competing uses of water among the conflicting states. This data will generate a grounded theory demonstrating the stakeholders’ attitudes toward the conflict and toward one another, the unique and contingent obstacles facing each stakeholder at various points during the conflict’s history, and each stakeholder’s goals and strategies used to overcome the water conflict.

Textual and discursive analytical techniques will then be used to critically evaluate the competing claims to power over the waters of the ACF River Basin. Press articles, public pronouncements, public and corporate documents, and media campaign documents will be collected and dramaturgically coded to produce a detailed chronological genealogy of the conflict. The focus here will be on the language employed to argue and propagate selected positions on the water “crisis.” This study offers the hypothesis that Georgia’s stakeholders have used a discourse of water scarcity to construct a self-serving interpretation of the water conflict, which differs greatly from the interpretations by stakeholders in Alabama, Florida, and USACE and that this constructed discourse claims that water scarcity results from drought conditions rather than ineffective resource management. By constructing a discourse of natural water scarcity, Georgia’s water regulators have been able to delay conflict resolution for almost two decades, thus sustaining metropolitan Atlanta’s economic growth and maintaining the region’s comparative advantages in order to further attract water-intensive industrial development.

Intellectual Merits

The intellectual merit of this study is that this will be the first study to empirically examine the role of combined and uneven development in the resolution of the growing crisis over limited freshwater among the States of Alabama, Florida, and Georgia. This study will also interrogate how competing discursive framings of the water conflict are being employed to argue for and propagate selected modes of governance relative to the growing crisis of demand for freshwater from the still plentiful ACF River Basin.

Broader Impacts

This study will also have profound impacts upon the (mis)management of water resources by critically examining how dominant state and corporate media discourses in the three competing states of Alabama, Florida, and Georgia are offering competing constructions of the crisis of freshwater so as to legitimize both intrastate and interstate water dispossessions. The proposed research is, therefore, strategically placed to inform the politics of freshwater supply management across the U.S. by questioning the current ad hoc water regime in the ACF River Basin and its equity and sustainability relative to the growth imperatives of the three competing states.

story:
About me

Hi there! I was born in Paris in 1985. Through a love of the outdoors and fortuitous hiking, I came to develop a fascination with glaciers and all things polar. I studied Physical Geography at the Paris VII University, sharing time between Paris and the Alps. After completing my Master degree, I moved to Alaska to work on a Fulbright-funded project aiming to better understand the dynamics of frozen ground. Later on, I focused on the study of Arctic glaciers with satellite images at the University of Alberta in Canada. I also pursue lattes with vigor.

What is Chasing Ice in Alaska?

The plan is to travel to southeast Alaska to be part of an expedition that will travel across the Juneau icefield with scientific purposes from June 23d to August 18th 2013. The expedition is organized by the Juneau Icefield Research Program (JIRP), the longest continuous research study of a glacial system in the Western Hemisphere.

The Juneau icefield is the fifth largest in the Western Hemisphere, covers approximately 4,400 square km (1,700 square miles) and feeds 35 large glaciers. We'll hike, cross rivers and mosquito forests and ski during 2 months over 200 km (125 miles), camp and check the glacier's vitals.

The main mission is to contribute to understand the dynamics of glacier systems as they relate to climate by collecting data on the icefield. Central to this understanding is the monitoring of glacier velocities and surface elevation changes. Through time, tracking these changes will provide key insights into climate change.

Why it matters

First, by contributing to this project you are a part of the effort aiming at better understanding glaciers/climate relations and you'll be in a sweet spot to hear a little about the story of one of the great frozen places on earth.

Second, this is the opportunity of a lifetime for a young glaciologist! With fellow scientists I'll gain crucial and intense fieldwork experience, learn and practice new skills (crevasse rescue...), manipulate scientific equipment, use new gear, get finally well acquainted with a terrain I have been studying for years via satellite images. This expedition will provide me with great stories to share. All this is exciting, brilliant for my career, and will give me a headstart for my doctoral program.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the budget:                                                                                 

  • Program fees (logistics, food, training etc.): 1950 €. The Juneau Icefield Research Program is generously covering half of the fees (1950 € is what is left)
  • Plane fares (Flights from Paris to Alaska, then from British Columbia to Paris + other fees: 1800 €                                            
  • Gear: 1600 €

Check out the perks on the right! I wil need to secure ~2000 € by June 5th and an additional ~3000 € by June 18th. If I do not secure enough funds, you will be refunded.


Other ways you can help: through airmiles donation and good vibes sending!

Background check?

  • Fulbright Foundation, Monahan grant for Environmental Sciences    
  • International Climate Change College, competitive program led by the WWF and Ben & Jerry's   
  • Presentations at international science conferences
  • Field experience in cold and remote environments

Check out http://www.juneauicefield.com/

Top left picture by Angus Duncan

Program fees (logistics, food, training etc.): 1950 €. The Juneau Icefield Research Program is generously covering half of the fees (1950 € is what is left)
Plane fares (Flights from Paris to Alaska, then from British Columbia to Paris + other fees: 1800 €                                            
Gear: 1600 €


Check out the perks on the right! I wil need to secure ~2000 € by June 5th and an additional ~3000 € by June 18th. If I do not secure enough funds, you will be refunded.
Other ways you can help: through airmiles donation and good vibes sending!


Background check?

Fulbright Foundation, Monahan grant for Environmental Sciences    
International Climate Change College, competitive program led by the WWF and Ben & Jerry's   
Presentations at international science conferences
Field experience in cold and remote environments

Check out http://www.juneauicefield.com/
Top left picture by Angus Duncan

story:
I'm Dr. Ed Marshall, a retired medical doctor who has also been involved in the home real estate market for many years, developing, remodeling, selling homes, and staging (furnishing) them to help them sell. Now I'm combining the desire to help people, my medical doctor's spirit, with my real estate experience, to reach homeowners in danger of losing their homes to short sales or foreclosures, and to reach lenders with my new HELPPR ("helper") plan that saves homes for the owners, and prevents loan losses for the lenders. We have real estate attorney and CPA approval of the plan, and it has worked!

There are millions of Americans threatened with the loss of their homes. Your contributions will help us get the publicity to let everyone know about the HELPPR plan, especially the executives who run the companies that service the loans and arrange for loan modifications. This new plan will make them really want to modify loans to help borrowers keep their homes, because the plan prevents lender loan losses too.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $5,000 to pay for publicity and press releases, and for mailings to lenders and their loan processing executives. The HELPPR plan has to get known for people to use it. I'm retired and I've already spent quite a bit, and it's time for the community to get involved to get the job done.

Anyone who contributes $50 or more will get our loan modification help absolutely free. Others pay $300, only AFTER they have received their signed loan modification. If you don't need help to save your home, you can name a friend, relative, or neighbor who can use our help. You've probably heard of people charging thousands for helping people get loans modified, and often it was all a scam.

If we don't reach our entire fund raising goal, every cent we get will still be used to get this home and loan saving plan better known. The more we raise, the sooner we can help more people.

The Impact

Imagine the impact on families who will not lose their homes, and their credit scores will not go down the drain. The whole community benefits. Builders will be encouraged to build homes if there are fewer foreclosures and short sales. If the home next door to you is sold cheaply as foreclosure or short sale, that hurts your home value, and threatens all who have made home loans in an area with many foreclosures and short sales. The HELPPR plan can stabilize the real estate market and help millions of homeowners cut their monthly payments in half or even lower, so they can afford those payments. Other countries with the same real estate loan problems can copy the HELPPR plan, helping millions more people and economies of all those countries.

I'll never forget the first homeowners I helped with this plan. They had been turned down for a loan modification and they were facing the imminent loss of their home. Now their loan has been modified and their payment is about half what it was! They don't have to move and lose their credit score.

Other Ways You Can Help: 

If you can't contribute, you can still help. Contact us by using our website at http://HomeandLoanSavers.com if you want our help to save your home, or tell anyone you know who needs that help about the HELPPR plan. If you know people who would want to contribute and they are able to do it, let them know about this campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Why An Eco stove?

In developing countries, there has been a welcome shift toward the use of more clean and sustainable cooking technologies and fuels, away from the traditional practice of cooking over open fires.

THIS

     TO THIS

 

RESEARCH;

According to research, in Uganda, 96% of the rural population relies on biomass for cooking and 89-90% of the population does not have a clean cookstove. About 19,700 Ugandans die every year from exposure to indoor air pollution (IAP). long times spent looking for fire wood, huge expenses in fuel costs. The contribution that firewood and charcoal make to Uganda’s GDP is estimated at US$48 million and US$26.8 million respectively (UNDP, 2011).Moreover, the excessive use of biomass for cooking has placed increasing pressure on the natural resources, including forest reserves

Charcoal production
 
Huge loss occurs during production and consumption of charcoal. nine bags of charcoal get lost through inefficient technologies used to convert wood into charcoal. 
 
“Highly inefficient technologies of charcoal are used such that for every one tone of charcoal, seven to nine tonnes of trees are cut,” says Ayongyera. a private consultant“ For efficient technologies to be adopted there is a need to organise the charcoal production sector.” http://www.newvision.co.ug/section/53-395-Environment.html 
 

This is a typical example of what our forests used to look like

  NOW THIS

 

 

       IMPACT CAUSED BY CHARCOAL .

 

Basic facts;

  • 1 bag of charcoal=2-3 trees-
  • an average family uses 2 bags of charcoal month
  • A bag of charcoal costs btn $30-$35
  • Only 10% of Ugandan household can access and afford the running cost of gas or electricity.
  • 89% of Ugandans depend on charcoal or firewood as cooking fuel
  • 1% use Bio-Gas
  • Electricity is only found in urban areas so people in rural areas depend on kerosene lamps or camp-like fire for light.
  • Every cook stove in the country has a running cost which is ever increasing.

WHO - on Indoor Air Pollution

Cooking and heating with solid fuels on open fires or traditional stoves results in high levels of indoor air pollution. Indoor smoke contains a range of health-damaging pollutants, such as small particles and carbon monoxide.

According to Global Health Risks: Mortality and burden of disease attributable to selected major risks indoor air pollution is responsible for 2.7% of the global burden of disease. other related illnesses & dangers faced include;

 

ECO STOVE;

The Eco stove is an innovation in Uganda and on the continent aimed at stopping IAP, conserve the environment as it saves the end user cooking fuel cost. Eco stove in none like any other cook stove on the market today and meets the KYOTO PROTOCOL. it is a simple, practical and its functions are aimed to meet the cooking needs of every day person. It is smoke free, more efficient, functional, modern and user friendly. 

People love using the Eco stove, we know because they have said so in the feedback report the company received.  This is a stove that is functional and more efficient than most cook stoves on the market in the country. This is because Eco stove designers, technicians and engineers worked together to create a stove that is as functional on the outside as on the inside. complete with a beautiful, presentable, look than most.

Three sizes, Three functions

Eco stove comes in 3 sizes; A single burner( ES10), A double burner (ED18) and an oven style size (EO30). This was intended to meet the user's cooking needs and capacity.

Three functions; Eco stove cooks, lights a home and charges phones. the 3 main basics needs of life today.

why do people prefer Eco stove?

Right from the start of our pilot programme, there as alot of love because of its unique features that even a gas, electric or most efficient cook chacoal cook stove does not have. it cooks with reusable yet heat retainant rocks that save the user the running cost, stones are smoke free, provides light and phone charging service, it is potable and can be used anywhere, both in urban, rural areas and camping. In order to increase its combustion, the stove has been adopted with an inbuilt air system that run on solar which introduces forced air to the rocks to make it more efficient.

If we can provide a single Eco stove to each family that uses charcoal or firewood, we can guarantee a huge reduction is carbon foot print and reduced environmental degradation for this generation and generations to come.

Stove Testing;

  1. Stove & kitchen performance tests,
  2. Stones testing,
  3. Emissions test,
  4. Water Boiling test,
  5. Beans Test. 
  6. Controlled cooking test

 

 

Test done by Uganda Industrial Research Institute (UIRI) on a ES10 Eco stove

  • Boiling: 5 minutes to boil 3 litres of water at 96 degrees
  • power output; 12 volts, 7 watts
  • Compatible Devices:  light bulbs and phone charging
  • Fuel: Briquettes /Stones
  • Fuel size; 1 kilogram of volcanic rocks
  • Weight: 12kgs (single) 
  • Materials: clay mould -insulator, galvanised steel, metal.
  • Other materials; solar/thermal-electric generator/electricity & fan.

 

 SOLUTION

Eco stove will put a stop at the running cooking fuel cost with its reusable, heat retainant rocks and the added benefits of light bulbs and phone charging accessories saves the user the money they do not have much of that is otherwise spent on phone charging fees and weekly transport costs Because its a necessity.

What makes an Eco stove?

Main; Galvanised metal sheets, other metal, Fan, clay liner/mould, insulation; pumice & Vermiculite, solar kit & Paint.

Fuels;

Volcanic rocks & Briquettes.

 

 

If every charcoal/firewood user owned an eco stove, we would improve alot of peoples lives, save on carbon foot prints, climate change and global warming.

PROTOTYPE in 2010;

  TO THIS;

we have been enged in exhibitions sensitizing the public about the availability of this alternative cooking solution across the country

 

 

Challenges we need help with;

  1. Capacity Building-build a bigger workshop, train more technicians
  2. Mass produce the eco stoves & branding
  3. Mechanise our production for capacity & quality
  4. Establish agreement with solar suppliers better still Make solar assembling at our workshop. this will cut-out the middle man which will reduce on the over all cost of an Eco stove making it much more affordable
  5. Build relationship with our suppliers for other materials to benefit from credit facilities.
  6. Hold workshops, awareness and training session to change behaviour -Make Eco stove a household product
  7. Establish more branches to east, west, northern parts of Uganda.
  8. Extract more reusable stones so people can easily adopt the stove with more confidence of their availability.
  9. Teach briquette making skills. Briquettes are currently a secondary source of fuel. the residues are used as fire starters and the skill gained will also earn them an income especially for women and unemployed youth.
  10. More Research and Development to perfect Eco stove. we need to do more research into the product so that we do not need to use the briquette as fire starters which will make it more user friendly.
  11. Sustainability. we have a product, we have come this far, with the additional support, we will be able to be self sustaining in 1yr

Through our exhibitions, road demos and extensive market research since 2010, we established that the need for the Eco stove is huge, the demand is high, our production capacity is very low. With the pilot Eco stoves project since 2011. the feedback has been exciting and encouraging. Adoptation was swift and Participating families have saved on average over 90% on their cooking fuel cost, we need to spread the same effect/benefit across Uganda, One family at a time. then to the Sub-sahara Africa.

The added benefits have encouraged regular use of the Eco stove thus achieving our core goals and objective, in the process, doing our bit to reduce on environmental degradation, climate change and Global warming.

 

A bit about Uganda;

Uganda has a Population of 35.6 million (UN, 2012) its Capital is Kampala, it seats on Area: 241,038 sq km (93,072 sq miles), Major languages: English (official), Swahili (official), Luganda, various Bantu and Nilotic languages, Major religions: Christianity, Islam, Life expectancy: 54 years (men), 55 years (women) (UN). It is a land locked country but was once rich and can still have food security if good practices are adopted. It is surrounded by lakes and rivers. we have national parks, the source of River Nile, rivers which are excellent for rafting, Dames, the Equator crosses Uganda, mountains such as Mt Rwenzori which has 4 seasons. Major tourist attractions, some, we will be happy to show our supporters once they visit. we have had a lot of media support and companies who are not able to financially support our cause but have offered us such perks as we offer them to you.

 

Why Is Eco stove right for the people??

Through our market research and pilot Eco stoves since 2011, the participating household appreciated the Eco stove innovation and its added benefits.

The innovation is smoke free for the benefit of a cooking child or woman, zips the ever increasing charcoal cost, adds value tot he entire family and reduce on the environmental degradation.

The benefits of an Eco stove compared to any other stoves on the market in the Uganda today.  in brief these are; environmental, social, economic, health and technological benefits; With An Eco stove,

Environmental aspects;

  • Reduced rate of deforestation,-90% 0f Ugandans depend on charcoal or firewood as their only source of cooking fuel, 10% can afford the recurring cost of gas or electricity monthly bill and only 1% use bio-gas
  • Reduced soil Erosion and its effects-mad slides due to deforestation for charcoal market
  • Reduce Drought and growing food shortage due to dry and infertile land
  • Reduce landfill/waste management by making briquettes used as fire starters
  • Reduce CO2 emissions/greenhouse gasses
  • Reduce wood consumption-due to the reusable stone
  • Save hectares of Wood land trees
  • Challenge fire Risks in glass thatched houses 

Social aspects;

  • women spending time with family due to Less time spent cooking
  • No more child missed classes in search for firewood/for a quick buck
  • Gender balance- stones are readily avalable and easily accessed by special interest groups (Women headed homes, disabled and the old)

Health Aspect;

  • No hospital bills due to indoor smoke (IAP) greatest most killer in africa-No more smoke inhalation for cooking women & children
  • Minimum fire accidents (due to safe insulation) tasted and certified by Uganda bureau of standards
  • Safe, Neat, Durable, Portable and meets all health and safety laws
  • Can be operated/used and handled by anyone and everyone

 

Economic aspects;

  • 2 years re-usable heat retention stones-saves loads of cooking fuel Money=$17-$35 -per week to cook, in a year, the cost of cooking fuel is above $800. an improved lifestyles for the entire family who will save this money by using an Eco stove
  • Employment and Apprenticeship opportunities; skilled/unskilled frofor production-supply-maintainance, in all parts of the country for easy access
  • Entrepreneurship opportunities-through training (Agents, maintenance/repair centres and monitoring of the eco stoves across the country)
  • Training and skills development opportunities-(stove manufacturing, distribution, solar assembling, briquette making)
  • No more firewood shortage/ hunting/collection challenges

 

Technology aspect;

  • With a Modern Look/accessories, state- of -the Art in the cooking technology, it will encourage every owner to actually use it regularly.
  • With 2 bulb light-enables rural school children extra reading time who would otherwise not afford over night kerosene bills- providing them improved grades and a brighter future
  • With 2 phone charging previsions = saves travel and charging fees to the trading centres where electricity can be found.
  • Cooks efficiently and consistently and half the time- its acceptable and functional and easy to operate by anyone
  • Ergonomics & safe to the touch

Your support.

WE need your support - financial support so as to continue in our Research and Development to make the Eco stove A household clean cook stove in Uganda, Africa and beyond where charcoal and firewood is predominantly the main source of cooking fuel. we need to mechanise our production to achieve the desired impact. we need to be able to own a solar assembling workshop or buy solar in bulk in order to benefit from bulk purchase discounts which will reduce the over all cost of the Eco stove. The need to train trainers who will teach local people the  briquette making skills so that they can learn to process their household waste into briquettes instead of contributing to land-fill which is used as fire starters for Eco stoves. We also need expert advise and support in this firld. Please Stand with us, help us take this innovation to the people of Uganda, help us make it accessible & affordable to the people who will greatly benefit from it, in the process, they will stop cutting down trees to cook which will positively impact on climate change.

Even when you cannot financially support us, you can network for us, spread the word for us. We are creating an Eco stove system, which is not yet fully accurate and yet to go on the Global market. Hence this is not our final clean cook stove. Through this campaign, you may contribute  any way possible and your input will affect the final design and characteristics of this cooking revolution for most. THANK YOU

Even when you cannot financially support us, you can network for us, spread the word for us. We are creating an Eco stove system, which is not yet fully accurate and yet to go on the Global market. Hence this is not our final clean cook stove. Through this campaign, you may contribute  any way possible and your input will affect the final design and characteristics of this cooking revolution for most. THANK YOU

story:
Please use the Share This Campaign Tools link via e-mail, Like via FB or Google+, or Tweet directly above to spread the word and expand the network.

 

COMMUNITY | SUSTAINABILITY | ENVIRONMENT |  ARTS . . .

Through application of these core concepts I will build upon a pilot project launched last year by planning and leading a hands-on long-term community development effort to alleviate poverty, food insecurity and environmental degredation in the rural areas of Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

This second campaign (version 2.0) will allow me to go back to Cambodia to serve the Wat Opot Children's Community (WOCC) and the people in the rural viillages surrounding WOCC for 4-5 weeks starting mid to end of February 2013.  The initial fundraising campaign and pilot project (version 1.0) results and progress may be viewed via my blog at http://briancambodiafoodsecurity.tumblr.com/. 

I will continue to conduct three specific, on-going, long-term programs aimed at bolstering the viability of a rural population disenfranchised by the rapid development of a Cambodia shifting towards modernity:

  1. Sustainable Agriculture and Food Security Training and Education benefiting ~30 adult village leaders and educators living with HIV/AIDS and in poverty while continuing to develop the demonstration center on WOCC's property

  2. Environmental and Teen Leadership Day benefiting children and teens (K-12) of WOCC and the surrounding villages living with HIV/AIDS and in poverty

  3. Dance (Hip-Hop, Break-dancing, Jazz, Contemporary, etc.) Competition benefiting children and teens (K-12) of WOCC and the surrounding villages living with HIV/AIDS and in poverty

The three programs were developed after a needs assessment performed in 2011 (v1.0), bolstering this region by:

  • Providing a training for the rural communities to adopt small-scale subsistence sustainable agricultural techniques and knowledge sharing forum to share best practices; hence, alleviating food insecurity and achieving food sovereignty free from external conventional agriculture forces (i.e. multi-national corporate chemical and/or GMO seed companies)
  • Engaging the youth of the rural communities through the arts (dance) and crafts (fun environmental related acitivities), which not only makes them stewards of their communities in the near term, but, also, provides leadership, planning and organizational skills supplementing their primary and secondary education, all of which is necessary for their success in the medium and long-term

In other words, together we can and are "CHANGING THE COURSE"

 

FUNDING AND TRANSPARENCY

FOR AS LITTLE AS $10 YOU COULD FUND:

  • 1 Adult Cambodian Community Leader impacted by HIV/AIDS and malnutrition to attend a Sustainable Agriculture and Food Security Training
  • 7 Cambodian Children/Teens to learn about life-long Sustainability and  Environment principles to conserve their resources as well as provide necessary Leadership Skills

  • 60 Children/Teens impacted by HIV/AIDS and Poverty to value community as well as learn about life long group dynamics and leadership skills, all of which builds confidence through the art of dance and healthy competition

There are THREE fundraising benchmarks to achieve:

  1. Raise $1,500 via online (Indiegogo) to run all three programs, provide my room and board, food, and part of the transportation costs

  2. Anything raised above benchmark #1 up to about $2,000 via online and offline (events in San Francisco) would go to most of my travel to and from Cambodia as well as other costs to conduct my work for WOCC and the surrounding villages

  3. Anything raised above benchmark #2, greater than about $2,000 will go towards WOCC General Funds


*Expenses Pie Chart Breakdown

*Expenses Spreadsheet Details

By donating you will be updated and will remain informed about the spending of the funds, which may slightly change pending on the need when I am on the ground . . . in-country.

*100% of donations will go towards bolstering the community; myself or anyone else stand to make NO income or recieve administrative fees (in-fact I'll take a salary hit, but, no worries I do this for the love of this community).

 

WHAT YOU GET FOR YOUR DONATION

Should you choose to recieve a gift for your donation, I will personally shop for gifts as described in the perks section at the local markets in Phnom Penh.  Perks will be mailed or pesonally given to you once I return from Cambodia.  You may also opt not to collect a gift.  If you didn't collect from the first campaign, you may still contact me to collect, the paintings are still sitting in a box under my bed! :).

*4 Percent of the donations will be collected by Indiegogo for running this service and platform.

OTHER INFORMATION

For more information on key partners click the following links:

  • Brian Reyes (me) - Planner, Organizer, Overseer of the entire project whom fundraises, plans and executes all programs for WOCC and the surrounding community

  • Wat Opot Children's Community (WOCC) - provides access to existing target beneficiaries and the central location of trainings, conferences, dancing competions, and/or meetings

  • Centre d'Etude et de Développement Agricole Cambodgien (CEDAC) - provides Cambodian Sustainable Agriculture training and resources, which is consistent with the values of this project

  • Global Service Corps - U.S. based non-profit responsible for initiating the pilot project and contributing resources

For more information about the Sustainable Agriculture techniques used:

  • Typical Biointensive Agriculture concepts via John Jeavons' GROWBIOINTENSIVE movement or Wikipedia
  • Techniques & Concepts used during v1.0 via my blog at http://briancambodiafoodsecurity.tumblr.com/


Remember to please spread the word by using the "Share This Campaign Tools" link below the initial photo/video above to spread the word.  Also, post and re-post this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, You Tube, LinkedIn, blogs, etc.  It would be much appreciated if you could ask your friends and family to help donate by directly contacting them.  If anyone has any questions, comments or just want to chat feel free to call me anytime at 415-730-8153 or email me at bareyes_1@hotmail.com.

story:
Sol Electrica has designed a modular-solar power plant (MsPP) that concentrates the suns radiant energy, changes it into thermal transportable heat which then is converted into mechanical energy.  This mechanical energy rotates a planetary gear box which drives an alternator to produce electricity.

Our sole goal is to design products which will replace our current technology and dependence on thermal and fossil fueled power plants to produce our electricity.  Sulfur oxides (SOx), mercury, traces of other metals, and, for coal-fired plants, fly ash.  Fossil fueled power stations are the major emitters of CO2, a greenhouse gas, which is a contributor to global warming.  Carbon capture and storage of emissions is not expected any time soon.

Why MsPP?  Size, use, and scalability.

We decided, early, that if we could only be just a little better then current technology than it would not be worth the effort.  Being twice or more as efficient as your nearest competitor and producing three times the daily electricity would be much more satisfying.

We began our design by looking at every available solar to electric system that had proven results which we could study.  Energy output vs. the square footage of the collection area for each system allowed us to easily calculate the efficiency and possible daily, weekly, and yearly output of each.  The solar tower configurations which area used in the Mojave Desert and the best solar cell (PVC) efficiencies in the world right now are between 21% to 31.25%.  We believe that our design, which takes the best from all sciences, will produce efficiencies of 60% or more.  How is this possible?

Everyone wants to create bigger and bigger solar power plants which they control and then can sell electricity back to the masses at a cost they decide.  We choose to go the opposite direction due to all the inherent solar radiation capture, heat receiver, and conventional turbine losses in efficiencies.  Each of our scientists, in the fields of physics, optics, thermodynamics, physical chemistry, material specialists, and mechanical design have attacked every point in each system that is inefficient and found a revolutionary solution to each.

Everyone that has been apart of the massive amounts of research and design have worked for free for the past year.  They believe.

Our MsPP easily fits on any home to provide an estimated 5,000-6,055 watts of usable electric power; power which if not totally used can be either stored or sold back into the grid.  By increasing the number (modular) or size of the collection platform, heat transfer fluid (HTF), and micro-boiler portions of the system the MsPP can putout up to 80,000 watts of electric power for schools and hospitals (many other commercial applications apply).  This scalability maximizes at 80,000 watts, past this need and the turbine and alternator need to be changed out for larger model designs.

Standard scientific formulas, found on the Sol-Electrica.com web site, show that for each elegant design the conversion formulas work to provide the final power output from the initial solar radiation input.  Our Science is sound!

What is needed next is protection.  Sol Electrica needs to patent five specific parts of the system and the system as a whole.  This is critical to have in order for us to move forward with the estimated 4.5 mil prototyping phase.  Funding will have to be provided by large altruistic corporations, individuals, or governments.  Without the patents our designs would be stolen, patented by others, used, or hidden from the public.

Please consider the possibilities of just the basic small single MsPP in a village 2,100 nM (nautical miles), anywhere, above or below the equator (half our planet).  This is the best placement of the MsPP for optimal output.  Each small parched village can now have electricity to run a small hospital, refrigeration for vaccines, water pumps, and fresh water.  By exchanging the micro-boiler (used in a closed residential water system) for a desalinization/potable water boiler the village can not have fresh water as a byproduct along with the electricity.  How many lives will this save and improve!?

Urgent, We need you!

Again, we need your help in this initial phase of our quest to help slow global warming and aid those in need with water and electricity.   Donating money, any money, to this cause is critical.  Once the patents are submitted funding for the prototypes begin.  This is the phase you need to follow, quickly everything will fall into place and you will begin hearing about us not only on the net but in the news.  The possibilities are almost endless as is the scope in which this can grow through your help.

 

Sincerely,

Michael (scientist, humanitarian, father)

Sol Electrica
